AD_Sarevok_FreeValeria.synopsis: Sarevok has a crime reaction to a party member trying to free Valeria from her chains at the Murder Tribunal/Blood Baptism.
AD_Sarevok_FreeValeria.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Baptism", then use "oe MT_Court" to teleport to the courtroom.- Walk to your right into the abattoir, where Valeria is chained by a blood pool.- Unlock the chain or just try to use it. If Sarevok can see this, he will say this AD as combat starts.

AD_Valeria_Fleeing.synopsis: If we attacked or threatened Valeria at the Murder Tribunal, she will instantly flee the scene once she's freed.
AD_Valeria_Fleeing.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "goto -1260 0 467" or go to S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Baptism_Valeria_Point_2ddc0200-9b06-436f-8d7c-b8f11498811c- Attack or threaten Valeria- Unlock Valeria's chains. She will flee instead of starting a dialogue with you.

Sendai.synopsis: Dialogue with the ghost of Sendai, bound to eternal service to Bhaal in her afterlife. In "Baldur's Gate 2: Throne of Bhaal", Sendai was one of the Five, an evil group of Bhaalspawn led by Amelyssan.
Sendai.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Start the Baptism of Blood ("oe MT_Baptism" or debugbook options)- Talk to Sendai in the abattoir.- If you complete the baptism and become an Unholy Assassin, she will have more to say.

AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer.synopsis: Dolor waits at the door to the Murder Tribunal's courtroom - the Death Knight dead or absent, waiting on his rumoured rival to become an Unholy Assassin to appear.
AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Start", enter the tombstone shop and go down into the Murder Tribunal- Use "oe MT_Dolor_NDK" to get Dolor to appear near the courtroom door and have the Death Knight be dead.- These ADs will be repeated during his idle behaviours.

AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism.synopsis: We enter the Abattoir, where Valeria is chained up, before starting the Blood Baptism. When she spots us, she will call for help.
AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- "goto -1260 -1 466" or go to S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Baptism_Valeria_Point_2ddc0200-9b06-436f-8d7c-b8f11498811c- Valeria will start the AD when she spots you, and it will be repeated every few seconds. It will stop if the Blood Baptism gets started.

Valeria.synopsis: Interactive dialogue with Valeria after taking down the Murder Tribunal and saving her from the Baptism of Blood. She will head off after this and disappear out of sight.
Valeria.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MT_Baptism" and then "goto -1259 2 466".- Attack anyone in the room except Valeria, then killcombat.- Once all Bhaalists are dead, use "oe MT_Baptism_Chained 0".- Speak to Valeria.

AD_Baptism_Cultists_Combat.synopsis: During the Baptism of Blood at the Murder Tribunal, numerous cultists will appear in the background, ritualistically chanting while the ritual goes on. If we attack them though, they will start doing this chant instead, on the first general combat turn.
AD_Baptism_Cultists_Combat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MT_Baptism" and then "goto -1259 2 466". The cultists will appear and start their chant - that chant is a different AD though.- Attack one of the cultists. On the first general combat turn, all the cultists will say this chant simultaneously.

AD_DeathKnight_Combat002.synopsis: Combat AD for the Murder Tribunal's Death Knight. This undead knight serves Bhaal and guards the door to the Murder Tribunal.
AD_DeathKnight_Combat002.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: goto -1308 5 522- This AD will play during combat with the Murder Tribunal Death Knight: S_LOW_MurderTribunal_DeathKnight_c16a1ebd-4390-4309-b5d5-30df6e1333f6

AD_Sarevok_Combat003.synopsis: Combat AD for Sarevok at the Murder Tribunal. Sarevok is presiding over the Murder Tribunal to judge Bhaalists who aspire to become Unholy Assassins.
AD_Sarevok_Combat003.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: "oe MT_Court"- This AD will play during combat with Sarevok: S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6

AD_Valeria_Combat.synopsis: Valeria enters combat at the Murder Tribunal. She will say this AD on her first combat turn.
AD_Valeria_Combat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Baptism", then use "oe MT_Court" to teleport to the courtroom.- Walk to your right into the abattoir, where Valeria is chained by a blood pool.- Unlock the chain with Knock, debug selecting and unlocking through ReCon or plain old lockpicking.- You and Valeria will enter combat against the Murder Tribunal. On Valeria's first combat turn, she will say this AD. You can always resurrect her if she winds up dead before her first turn.

AD_Valeria_Chained.synopsis: Valeria protests being abducted and chained up during the Baptism of Blood at the Murder Tribunal.
AD_Valeria_Chained.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Baptism" and then "oe MT_Court" to start the baptism and teleport to the courtroom.- Walk to the room on the right - the abattoir - to find Valeria chained up there and saying this AD once you're nearby. She will play an AD every time after the cultists do two chants.

Sarevok_Trial.synopsis: CINE ARTIST - PLEASE CONTACT WRITER RE. STRUCTURE - IT'S NOT THAT BAD, PROMISEDialog with Sarevok and his Murder Tribunal - will begin when approaching the Murder Tribunal in an underground area beneath Baldur's Gate. Sarevok will judge whether the player is worthy of receiving the title of "Unholy Assassin" - or tell the court to attack if we are deemed unworthy. If this part of the trial succeeds, the Tribunal will move on to the "Baptism of Blood" ritual (LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_BloodBaptism).
Sarevok_Trial.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal (goto -1284 1 504) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6)- If you want to do the trial, use "MT_GetDolorItems" to get one of the victim's hands.- Get spotted by the members of the court (Sarevok or his three servants).- This can also be triggered by entering a checkpoint trigger.

DeathKnight.synopsis: Dialog with the Death Knight sentry guarding the courtroom of the Murder Tribunal, in an underground area beneath Baldur's Gate. If you know that this is where you become an Unholy Assassin - and you have a victim's hand with you - he will let you through to be judged by the tribunal.
DeathKnight.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal (goto -1319 3 516) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_DeathKnight_c16a1ebd-4390-4309-b5d5-30df6e1333f6)- If you want to avoid the death knight becoming hostile, use "MT_GetDolorItems" to get one of the victim's hands and a note from Orin.- Read the note from Orin to learn about becoming an Unholy Assassin - otherwise you will not get the right dialog option to bypass the Death Knight.- Approach the Death Knight - upon spotting you, he will talk to you.

AD_DeathKnight_Combat001.synopsis: Combat AD for the Murder Tribunal's Death Knight. This undead knight serves Bhaal and guards the door to the Murder Tribunal.
AD_DeathKnight_Combat001.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: goto -1308 5 522- This AD will play during combat with the Murder Tribunal Death Knight: S_LOW_MurderTribunal_DeathKnight_c16a1ebd-4390-4309-b5d5-30df6e1333f6

AD_Valeria_Attacked.synopsis: AD for attacking Valeria at the Murder Tribunal, while she is chained. The AD is on a cooldown for a few seconds, so it cannot be spammed.
AD_Valeria_Attacked.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- "goto -1260 -1 466" or go to S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Baptism_Valeria_Point_2ddc0200-9b06-436f-8d7c-b8f11498811c- Attack Valeria while she is chained up. The AD will be on cooldown for a few seconds.

AD_Sarevok_DeathBringerAssault.synopsis: Combat AD for Sarevok at the Murder Tribunal. Sarevok is presiding over the Murder Tribunal to judge Bhaalists who aspire to become Unholy Assassins. This is for when he uses Target_LOW_DeathbringerAssault_Sarevok
AD_Sarevok_DeathBringerAssault.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: "oe MT_Court"- This AD will play during combat with Sarevok when he casts Target_LOW_DeathbringerAssault_Sarevok. He will need to perform a few main hand attacks before he can use this spell.

AD_Dolor_DeathKnight.synopsis: If the party has killed two of the murder targets themselves, Dolor will come to the Murder Tribunal instead of his usual questline. When we approach, we can overhear Dolor and the Death Knight discussing that there is another aspirant seeking the Murder Tribunal.
AD_Dolor_DeathKnight.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Start", enter the tombstone shop and go down into the Murder Tribunal- Use "oe MT_Dolor 1" to get Dolor to appear at the Death Knight guarding the courtroom.- Walk up near them without getting spotted, and this AD will play.

AD_Baptism_Cultists.synopsis: During the Baptism of Blood at the Murder Tribunal, numerous cultists will appear in the background, ritualistically chanting while the ritual goes on.
AD_Baptism_Cultists.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MT_Baptism" and then "goto -1259 2 466". The cultists will appear and start their chant.

PAD_BecameUnholyAssassin.synopsis: The party reacts to becoming an Unholy Assassin in the Bhaalist Murder Tribunal. This means Valeria was killed by either us or some other party member - if she was killed before we reached the Tribunal, her corpse will be here and we still bathe in her blood. Different companions will have different reactions to what they just did in order to become an Unholy Assassin.
PAD_BecameUnholyAssassin.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use the debugbook options for the Murder Tribunal (act 3/LOW) to start the trial and go to the abattoir (Valeria can either be already dead or alive, it doesn't matter)- Alternatively, use ReCon command "oe MT_Baptism" and "oe MT_Court"- Kill Valeria if she's alive, otherwise step into the font of blood if she's already dead- You will become an Unholy Assassin - a few seconds after the wrap-up dialogue, this PAD will play.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism.synopsis: The trial of the Murder Tribunal culminates in the Baptism of Blood, in the abattoir. The Tribunal will have either abducted Valeria, the Hollyphant detective, and chained her up here in order to be sacrificed, or she is already dead and you will just need to bathe in her blood.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal (goto -1284 1 504) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6)- If you want to do the trial, check LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_Trial for further instructions.- If you want to skip ahead, use ReCon command "oe MT_Baptism" or "MT_Baptism_Dead" (for Valeria to have already been killed).

AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight.synopsis: Dolor waits at the door to the Murder Tribunal's courtroom in front of the Death Knight, frustrated at a new rival that is seeking out the Murder Tribunal to become an Unholy Assassin.
AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Start", enter the tombstone shop and go down into the Murder Tribunal- Use "oe MT_Dolor 1" to get Dolor to appear at the Death Knight guarding the courtroom.- In his idle behaviours, Dolor will do this AD every now and then.

AD_Dolor_NoDoorKey.synopsis: If we convince Dolor to attack the members of the Murder Tribunal, but he cannot find the key to unlock the courtroom door, he will say this AD.
AD_Dolor_NoDoorKey.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Start", enter the tombstone shop and go down into the Murder Tribunal- Ctrl+Shift+K the Death Knight guarding the door- Grab the key to the courtroom door off his corpse- Use "oe MT_Dolor 1" to get Dolor to appear at the door.- Convince Dolor to attack the Tribunal with you (roll amazing + persuasion roll)

AD_Sarevok_Combat002.synopsis: Combat AD for Sarevok at the Murder Tribunal. Sarevok is presiding over the Murder Tribunal to judge Bhaalists who aspire to become Unholy Assassins.
AD_Sarevok_Combat002.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: "oe MT_Court"- This AD will play during combat with Sarevok: S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6

TombstoneShop_Password.synopsis: The secret entrance to the Murder Tribunal, the door of a decrepit tombstone shop, will open when the Word of Passage is spoken: Quietus (Latin for silence). The door will then unlock itself.
TombstoneShop_Password.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Tombstone shop door (goto 68 41 21) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_TombstoneShop_Door_ef23ee25-c62e-4fab-badd-4f98e364ebd5)- Use "oe MT_Start" to go to the door ORuse "oe MT_GetDolorItems", read Orin's note and learn the Word of Passage that will open the door.- Interact with the door while it is still locked.

Sarevok_Trespass.synopsis: Trespass dialog for approaching the Murder Tribunal without becoming an Unholy Assassin. Sarevok will warn you.
Sarevok_Trespass.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal (goto -1255 1 503) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Court_WarningSpot_Box_e543dbbf-aca6-4214-80df-db8de06fbe72)- Enter the trespass trigger near the members of the tribunal: see the GUID above.

Dolor.synopsis: Dialog with the Death Knight sentry guarding the courtroom of the Murder Tribunal, in an underground area beneath Baldur's Gate. If you know that this is where you become an Unholy Assassin - and you have a victim's hand with you - he will let you through to be judged by the tribunal.
Dolor.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal (goto -1319 3 516) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_DeathKnight_c16a1ebd-4390-4309-b5d5-30df6e1333f6)- If you want to avoid the death knight becoming hostile, use "MT_GetDolorItems" to get one of the victim's hands and a note from Orin.- Read the note from Orin to learn about becoming an Unholy Assassin - otherwise you will not get the right dialog option to bypass the Death Knight.- Approach the Death Knight - upon spotting you, he will talk to you.

AD_Sarevok_Combat001.synopsis: Combat AD for Sarevok at the Murder Tribunal. Sarevok is presiding over the Murder Tribunal to judge Bhaalists who aspire to become Unholy Assassins.
AD_Sarevok_Combat001.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: "oe MT_Court"- This AD will play during combat with Sarevok: S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6

AD_Sarevok_OnDeath.synopsis: Death AD for Sarevok at the Murder Tribunal. Sarevok is presiding over the Murder Tribunal to judge Bhaalists who aspire to become Unholy Assassins. He will react differently, depending on how far the player has advanced in to the Murder Tribunal.
AD_Sarevok_OnDeath.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: "oe MT_Court"- This AD will play when Sarevok dies: S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6

AD_Dolor_NoDeathKnight.synopsis: If we killed two targets from the murder target list, Dolor will make his way to the Murder Tribunal. If the Death Knight guarding the door is unavailable at this point, Dolor will instantly turn on us when he sees us.
AD_Dolor_NoDeathKnight.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Start", enter the tombstone shop and go down into the Murder Tribunal- Ctrl+Shift+K the Death Knight guarding the door- Use "oe MT_Dolor 1" to get Dolor to appear at the door.- This AD will play once when you enter combat with him.

Illasera.synopsis: Dialogue with the ghost of Illasera, bound to eternal service to Bhaal in her afterlife. In "Baldur's Gate 2: Throne of Bhaal", Illasera was one of the Five, an evil group of Bhaalspawn led by Amelyssan.
Illasera.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Start the Baptism of Blood ("oe MT_Baptism" or debugbook options)- Talk to Illasera in the abattoir.- If you complete the baptism and become an Unholy Assassin, she will have more to say.

Amelyssan.synopsis: Dialogue with the ghost of Amelyssan, bound to eternal service to Bhaal in her afterlife. In "Baldur's Gate 2: Throne of Bhaal", she attempted to usurp Bhaal's portfolio of murder and absorb Bhaal's essence. Now she is no more than a spectral slave.
Amelyssan.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Start the Baptism of Blood ("oe MT_Baptism" or debugbook options)- Talk to Amelyssan in the abattoir.- If you complete the baptism and become an Unholy Assassin, she will have more to say.

AD_DeathKnights_Weak.synopsis: Wordless AD interaction with the mute, weaker Death Knights supporting the main Death Knight in the Murder Tribunal foyer.
AD_DeathKnights_Weak.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_RandomHand"- Go to the Murder Tribunal Death Knights, get spotted by the main Death Knight- Offer him the hand, end the dialogue- Talk to the other Death Knights.

Merchant.synopsis: After completing the Murder Tribunal trial and completing the Baptism of Blood, the Echo of Abazigal will appear in the courtroom to provide you with Bhaalist/assassiny wares. Abazigal was one of the Five Bhaalspawn from BG2: Throne of Bhaal.
Merchant.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Either complete the Baptism of Blood or use the Murder Tribunal's debugbook quest flags and options to become an Unholy Assassin and spawn the Murder Merchant.- The Echo of Abazigal will appear in the courtroom near the judicial seats of Sarevok and the other Bhaalspawn.

AD_Dolor_Betrayal.synopsis: After killing the Murder Tribunal, Dolor turns on our party and starts attacking us.
AD_Dolor_Betrayal.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Start", enter the tombstone shop and go down into the Murder Tribunal- Use "oe MT_Dolor_Assault_Cheats" to get Dolor to appear at the Death Knight guarding the courtroom. He will start attacking the Death Knight and will then turn his attention to the Murder Tribunal.- It's best to join this combat and use "killcombat", provided Dolor is still neutral to us.- If Dolor somehow survives the whole ordeal and the Tribunal ends up dead, he will turn on the players and say this AD on his first combat turn.

AD_Sarevok_Combat004.synopsis: Combat AD for Sarevok at the Murder Tribunal. Sarevok is presiding over the Murder Tribunal to judge Bhaalists who aspire to become Unholy Assassins.
AD_Sarevok_Combat004.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal: "oe MT_Court"- This AD will play during combat with Sarevok: S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6

AD_Sarevok_SmiteDolor.synopsis: If Dolor is at the Murder Tribunal and ends up attacking them, Sarevok will mercilessly smite them (using power word "Kill").
AD_Sarevok_SmiteDolor.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use "oe MT_Start", enter the tombstone shop and go down into the Murder Tribunal- Use "oe MT_Dolor_Assault_Cheats" to get Dolor to appear at the Death Knight guarding the courtroom. He will start attacking the Death Knight and will then turn his attention to the Murder Tribunal.- Once Sarevok is in combat with Dolor, Sarevok will say this AD and smite Dolor (if we are using cheats, his health is significantly boosted and he will survive the power word Kill, and the AD will repeat on Sarevok's every turn.

AD_Sarevok_FreeValeria_0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_FreeValeria_0.text: Miserable worm. You will plead for death before the end.

AD_Valeria_Fleeing_0.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Fleeing_0.text: This place is foul as piss - I'm out of here.

Sendai_0.speaker: Echo of Sendai
Sendai_0.text: Welcome to our cause, Unholy Assassin. May your service to Bhaal be savage.
Sendai_0.context: NodeContext: solemn and sinister - you're in a place of great reverence to your god bhaal

Sendai_1.speaker: Echo of Sendai
Sendai_1.text: Descend into blood. Ascend into greatness.
Sendai_1.context: NodeContext: with great reverence - this is an unholy rite of great importance

AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer_0.text: If I'd only known of another - every whelp in this city would've been gutted.

AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer_2.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer_2.text: It's fine... Whoever else appears, they will be bested. I will triumph.

AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer_3.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_IdleWaitingFoyer_3.text: None could possibly have devoted as much blood to the Lord of Murder...

AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_0.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_0.text: Get here and free me at once!

AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_2.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_2.text: They're supposed to be locked up, not me! Get me OUT!

AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_3.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_3.text: Oi! Citizen! Get me out of here!

AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_4.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_BeforeBaptism_4.text: Have you no ears? Or are you just thick? FREE ME.

Valeria_5.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_5.text: Citizen! Thank the gods you're here.

Valeria_7.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_7.text: My wrinkles are starting to chafe. As an officer of the law, I demand you free me at once.

Valeria_12.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_12.text: Thanks for freeing me so quickly. No idea what those Bhaalist berks had planned with me, but those chains were starting to chafe.

Valeria_18.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_18.text: Took you bloody long enough - you've no idea how wrinkles like mine get caught in chains like that.

Valeria_13.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_13.text: I suppose some thanks are in order - you did a good job putting a stop to those Bhaalist berks.

Valeria_10.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_10.text: Though I do wish you'd figured this all out before I - ah - put the blame for Father Lorgan's murder on that poor refugee. Well. At least it's over now.

Valeria_6.speaker: Player
Valeria_6.text: I didn't do it for you. I did it to gain access to Orin.

Valeria_22.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_22.text: Oh. Well. I'd call you rude, but I have the misfortune of owing you my life.

Valeria_27.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_27.text: You gave these reprobates a proper seeing to. You clearly have what I don't. Courage. Insight. Heroism.

Valeria_0.speaker: Player
Valeria_0.text: How did you end up here?

Valeria_21.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_21.text: After our chat at Sharess' Caress, I thought it best to polish off the bottle I had started. I started coming over all woozy...

Valeria_33.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_33.text: My joints stiffened up quicker than a brothel-browser's loins. Paralysed. My vision went black. When I woke up - I was in chains.

Valeria_37.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_37.text: Overall - a terrible ordeal. One deserving of a drink. I'd bid you good day, but it's been royally shite all round.

Valeria_43.speaker: Player
Valeria_43.text: It's about to get worse. We need to put a stop to the Bhaalist resurgence.

Valeria_16.speaker: Player
Valeria_16.text: Don't go yet - we still don't know what Bhaal is planning!

Valeria_2.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_2.text: There is no 'we' in this equation, my friend. I assure you, I am quite finished. Besides, it's plain to see that I'm well out of my depth here.

Valeria_23.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_23.text: But you... Well, you gave these reprobates a proper seeing to. You clearly have what I don't. Courage. Insight. Heroism.

Valeria_30.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_30.text: The city needs you. I overheard these pigs talking - there's a Bhaal temple deep within the old Undercity that the cult is using.

Valeria_40.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_40.text: A century ago it was destroyed by a group of heroic sorts. Let's hope history repeats itself, eh?

Valeria_39.speaker: Jaheira
Valeria_39.text: Mind who you call history, hollyphant.
Valeria_39.context: NodeContext: Deadpan - flat warning to Valeira, who unwittingly referred to her deeds as if they happened centuries ago.

Valeria_32.speaker: Minsc
Valeria_32.text: The wrinkled orb is correct! Boo remembers the stench of the temple still.
Valeria_32.context: NodeContext: Referring to Valeira the hollyphant, still no idea what it is

Valeria_1.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_1.text: Very good. Now less talk, and find that temple!
Valeria_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suggestion that Valeria gives something / points towards something off-screen for the player.

Valeria_15.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_15.text: You might not be finished - I am. It's plain to see that I'm well out of my depth here.

Valeria_9.speaker: Player
Valeria_9.text: Aren't you going to stick around for the conclusion of the case?

Valeria_28.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_28.text: I assure you, I am quite finished. Besides, it's plain to see that I'm well out of my depth here.

Valeria_25.speaker: Player
Valeria_25.text: I think it's best you get out of here.

Valeria_36.speaker: Valeria
Valeria_36.text: I was enjoying a fabulous glass - well, several glasses - of some gnomish joymead at Sharess' Caress, when I came over all woozy.

Valeria_41.speaker: Player
Valeria_41.text: We're not finished yet - the ritual was just the beginning of Bhaal's resurgence.

Valeria_11.speaker: Player
Valeria_11.text: I think this Tribunal was testing people for something else - we're not finished yet.

Valeria_42.speaker: Player
Valeria_42.text: If I know Bhaal, this isn't over.

AD_Baptism_Cultists_Combat_0.speaker: Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost

AD_Baptism_Cultists_Combat_1.speaker: Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost

AD_DeathKnight_Combat002_0.speaker: That Which Guards
AD_DeathKnight_Combat002_0.text: This room will be thy resting place.

AD_Valeria_Combat_0.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Combat_0.text: You want a piece of me? Come and fucking get it!

AD_Valeria_Combat_1.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Combat_1.text: Listen up, you ghostly pricks - mess with the mastodon, you get the tusks!

AD_Valeria_Chained_0.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_0.text: Yes, we're all very impressed, now RELEASE ME!
AD_Valeria_Chained_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Trial resolved in this case means the entire Tribunal was killed.

AD_Valeria_Chained_1.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_1.text: YOU DO NOT WANT TO ANGER ME!

AD_Valeria_Chained_2.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_2.text: The stench of this place is just disgraceful.

AD_Valeria_Chained_3.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_3.text: Blessed silence. The chanting was nearly worse than the chains.

AD_Valeria_Chained_4.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_4.text: Kill me, then! See how long it takes for the Watch to catch you!

AD_Valeria_Chained_6.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_6.text: But... why? Please, you don't have to do this!
AD_Valeria_Chained_6.context: NodeContext: reacting to the palyer turning on them and attacking

AD_Valeria_Chained_7.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Chained_7.text: When I get out of these chains, my wrath will be terrible!

Sarevok_Trial_1.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_1.text: O Hail, true Chosen. May you bring death wherever you walk.

Sarevok_Trial_330.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_330.text: You gaze upon your disgraced kin, those who were sacrificed where you were raised up.

Sarevok_Trial_135.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_135.text: My idol, my hero, even in death.

Sarevok_Trial_80.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_80.text: Silence, spawn. Our undeaths are not to be admired. They are a punishment for our failures.

Sarevok_Trial_501.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_501.text: Why are you pieces of jerky still alive?

Sarevok_Trial_456.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_456.text: Pathetic. Too afraid to die when you should have?

Sarevok_Trial_342.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_342.text: Ha. I killed Jaheira: your own slaughterer.

Sarevok_Trial_26.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_26.text: Exquisite. I claim afore Father that I desire all deaths equally. In my private worship, though, I have found myself turning again and again to prayers for her demise.

Sarevok_Trial_270.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_270.text: We honoured Bhaal with our deaths, but he dragged us into these husked forms, to bring the lash upon the Gate, and nurse his dread cult in its dormant years.

Sarevok_Trial_231.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_231.text: We preside over the Tribunal, which has initiated many assassins into the ranks in the Temple. Here we remain until another of our line ends time itself.

Sarevok_Trial_245.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_245.text: And I will be that world-ender.

Sarevok_Trial_58.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_58.text: Don't tell me I am to be tested again.

Sarevok_Trial_364.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_364.text: Unholy Chosen, of course you are above needing to prove yourself to the Tribunal.

Sarevok_Trial_41.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_41.text: But the truth of Bhaal's will remains. Any Bhaalspawn who can kill a Chosen has a hope of becoming the Chosen themselves.

Sarevok_Trial_309.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_309.text: I fear we must kill one another. It is Father's way. Two Children must not both leave a holy site alive.

Sarevok_Trial_114.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_114.text: You don't have a hope in the Hells of defeating me.

Sarevok_Trial_92.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_92.text: That's pure delusion. Bhaal would never anoint you as the Chosen, worm.

Sarevok_Trial_215.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_215.text: My aching bones still feel every spark of pain from the crystalline moment of my death.

Sarevok_Trial_97.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_97.text: Even if I cannot defeat you, perhaps at last he will let me die.

Sarevok_Trial_132.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_132.text: Let us die, Chosen. As only Bhaalspawn can die.

Sarevok_Trial_271.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_271.text: What a treat. Just like your granddaughter was, gargling on her own blood.

Sarevok_Trial_76.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_76.text: I thank you for killing my granddaughter. She could not have been dispatched by better. Nor could I.

Sarevok_Trial_519.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_519.text: To arms, then. In Bhaal's name.

Sarevok_Trial_55.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_55.text: What trials are set upon them?

Sarevok_Trial_415.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_415.text: They must craft a series of kills, reaping divine tragedy and greater terror besides. At the last, an innocent must be gutted while the Tribunal judges the initiate's knife-hand.

Sarevok_Trial_435.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_435.text: I suppose there will not be the need for the Tribunal, now a true prophet of Bhaal has arisen again. You will name your new Unholy Assassins directly.

Sarevok_Trial_175.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_175.text: A pleasing thing, to see these stones stained with the blood of she who disgraced my Father.

Sarevok_Trial_227.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_227.text: The holy fool, who purged Bhaal's blessing and ruined their once-perfect form. Your death is a welcome offering here.

Sarevok_Trial_382.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_382.text: These are not aspirants. You have brought traitors of Bhaal into our midst.

Sarevok_Trial_464.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_464.text: Does it hurt, Sarevok? To be confronted with yet another of your brood who is not so desperate for daddy's attention as you are?
Sarevok_Trial_464.context: NodeContext: Scornful, pride in player - who is also a child of Bhaal, but rejects their evil heritage

Sarevok_Trial_291.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_291.text: What fate does Bhaal have in store for me?

Sarevok_Trial_188.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_188.text: Fate is written, and I have read it... you shall know soon enough.

Sarevok_Trial_117.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_117.text: Know that while I sit here in this husk, and in every moment, experience the crystalline pain of the moment of my death.

Sarevok_Trial_182.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_182.text: But my fate is a paradise, compared to the one Father has in store for you.

Sarevok_Trial_523.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_523.text: Why are you pieces of jerky still alive?

Sarevok_Trial_292.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_292.text: Pathetic. You worship death, yet have come back to life.

Sarevok_Trial_219.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_219.text: You were the greatest hope we had for centuries...

Sarevok_Trial_167.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_167.text: You're out of luck. Bhaal's hold over me is gone.

Sarevok_Trial_124.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_124.text: His ire may be quiet now, and you may not have become his brutal prophet.

Sarevok_Trial_21.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_21.text: But the line is not ended... You carry him with you, deep within. In your Divine Essence.

Sarevok_Trial_506.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_506.text: We have both failed Bhaal, let us die again, this time by each other's hands in his holy site. Each breath you take is an insult to him.

Sarevok_Trial_392.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_392.text: You're out of luck. I have escaped Bhaal's will.

Sarevok_Trial_320.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_320.text: I defeated Orin. You are nothing.

Sarevok_Trial_313.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_313.text: You sacrificed your kin, the most sacred act a Bhaalian could conduct, and summoned him with her blood.

Sarevok_Trial_397.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_397.text: Just to mingle your pissing fear with her gall-puddle. There are no words for this blasphemy.

Sarevok_Trial_403.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_403.text: I will save this city. A Bhaalspawn can have a true heart.

Sarevok_Trial_284.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_284.text: It may not be this decade, may not be this century, but a true Spawn, our Dread Father incarnate, will one day be born, and will destroy this city.

Sarevok_Trial_242.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_242.text: A pleasing thing, to see these stones stained with the blood of he who disgraced my Father.

Sarevok_Trial_307.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_307.text: The weakest worm of a Bhaalspawn, the holy fool. Whelp, know that Bhaal has a worse fate in stall for you than you could ever fear.

Sarevok_Trial_363.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_363.text: Walk well in the Dread Lord's bloody footsteps.

Sarevok_Trial_467.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_467.text: You gaze upon Murder's progeny, child.

Sarevok_Trial_98.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Sarevok_Trial_98.text: Prodigal servants, each returned to do his bidding eternally.

Sarevok_Trial_336.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_336.text: *In years past you brought this man low - foiled his plot to become a god. Now you stand before him, once again. Sarevok Anchev.*

Sarevok_Trial_59.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_59.text: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.

Sarevok_Trial_122.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_122.text: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.

Sarevok_Trial_457.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_457.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron strings, I see.

Sarevok_Trial_32.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_32.text: Your face bears the marks of many years, Jaheira. Your wit, however, does not.

Sarevok_Trial_194.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_194.text: You were never more to my Father than a stinging insect - irritating, but irrelevant. And yet you still scrabble for his attention.

Sarevok_Trial_87.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_87.text: You are unworthy of Bhaal's presence, let alone his trial.

Sarevok_Trial_107.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_107.text: But for one purpose you are fit indeed - you will make a fine offering to the Murder Lord.

Sarevok_Trial_346.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_346.text: While you wriggled 'neath the city's soil like the worm that you are. It will please my hamster to kill you twice, Sarevok.

Sarevok_Trial_162.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_162.text: You are as stupid as I recall, man of stone.

Sarevok_Trial_404.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_404.text: As you stood a statue, Stone Lord, a helpless ornament, your city changed. Warped. Became ripe for the plucking.

Sarevok_Trial_236.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_236.text: *Though this city is not your home, this man's infamy is known to you, and his presence sparks dread in the pit of your stomach.*

Sarevok_Trial_386.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_386.text: *Before you is Sarevok Anchev - a Bhaalist who almost brought Baldur's Gate to ruin a century ago.*

Sarevok_Trial_193.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_193.text: *Devella was right. Not just an imitator, but Sarevok himself.*

Sarevok_Trial_116.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_116.text: This is the court of the Dread Lord's tribunal. I am its custodian.

Sarevok_Trial_440.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_440.text: Here come those who seek to transcend. Aspirants of his most profane order - the would-be Unholy Assassins of Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_324.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_324.text: But these are not aspirants. You have brought traitors of Bhaal into our midst.

Sarevok_Trial_30.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_30.text: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.

Sarevok_Trial_308.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_308.text: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.

Sarevok_Trial_221.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_221.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron strings, I see.

Sarevok_Trial_10.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_10.text: You disappoint me, child of Murder. I expected more of your return.

Sarevok_Trial_240.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_240.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A relic of your cursed line, a Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen.*

Sarevok_Trial_101.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_101.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen, long ago. A spilled stain of Father's Divine Essence left out to dry.*

Sarevok_Trial_468.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_468.text: *And yet, the history he shares with your companion seems to run almost as deep as your own.*

Sarevok_Trial_407.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_407.text: *The history they share may be long gone, but the threat of violence between them is as fresh as newly spilled blood - neither party will let the other walk out of here alive.*

Sarevok_Trial_267.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_267.text: What purpose do you have in bringing these heretics to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.

Sarevok_Trial_277.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_277.text: Wait, how do you know each other?

Sarevok_Trial_485.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_485.text: Wait, how do you know each other?

Sarevok_Trial_136.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_136.text: Wait, how do you know each other?

Sarevok_Trial_371.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_371.text: Simple. We beat him about the brow and butt until he was dead.
Sarevok_Trial_371.context: NodeContext: No nonsense. Distastefully and bluntly telling the player how you know Sarevok.

Sarevok_Trial_74.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_74.text: Sarevok once fancied himself Bhaal's Chosen, until we put him in his place. Feel no shame for forgetting him - history shall do the same.
Sarevok_Trial_74.context: NodeContext: Jeering, has absolutely no time for Sarevok

Sarevok_Trial_134.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_134.text: These two have long meddled in my affairs - and my father's.
Sarevok_Trial_134.context: NodeContext: 'These two' refers to Minsc and Jaheira

Sarevok_Trial_256.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_256.text: This one has long meddled in my affairs - and my father's.

Sarevok_Trial_27.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_27.text: We're not here to dig up old feuds. I seek a path to the Temple of Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_316.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_316.text: You speak of the past - I speak of the future. Well, aspirant? Do the shades of yesterday speak for you, too?

Sarevok_Trial_473.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_473.text: There are two paths to the Temple of Bhaal: to carve your devotion into flesh, or to be the carcass that is carved upon.

Sarevok_Trial_44.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_44.text: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Minsc and Jaheira answer to me. They won't be a problem.

Sarevok_Trial_450.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_450.text: You make promises that aren't yours to keep. Take care that their breaking does not break something more.

Sarevok_Trial_201.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_201.text: If Minsc is certain of one thing, it is that he very much plans on being a problem for Sarevok.

Sarevok_Trial_474.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_474.text: I know these two well. I have travelled in their company. Whatever else may be said of them, they answer to no one but themselves.

Sarevok_Trial_138.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_138.text: I know this one well. I have travelled in her company. Whatever else may be said of her, she answers to no one but herself.

Sarevok_Trial_359.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_359.text: It seems there is some disagreement on who is master here.

Sarevok_Trial_360.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_360.text: You follow me. You dare question the SLAYER-LORD?

Sarevok_Trial_487.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_487.text: Do you dare doubt me? The child of Bhaal himself? ON YOUR KNEES, FILTH.

Sarevok_Trial_54.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_54.text: Is it to be death, then? A better alternative to watching this sick family reunion.
Sarevok_Trial_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira bows before Sarevok, annoyed with the player.NodeContext: Irritated, disappointed

Sarevok_Trial_463.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_463.text: You have shown us the colour of your blood. Boo wonders if we had been wiser to spill it on the ground.
Sarevok_Trial_463.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok, surprised and sad.NodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok, surprised and sad.

Sarevok_Trial_189.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_189.text: I'll prove it to you, Sarevok. ON YOUR KNEES, FILTH.

Sarevok_Trial_20.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_20.text: Only because I can no longer bear to look you in the eye.
Sarevok_Trial_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira bows before Sarevok, annoyed with the player.NodeContext: Despite yourself, the player has intimidated you into bowing before an old enemy. Irritated, won't be cowed long

Sarevok_Trial_406.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_406.text: I would prefer to stoop over Sarevok's corpse.
Sarevok_Trial_406.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok,NodeContext: Quietly fuming, bowing because he was forced to

Sarevok_Trial_250.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_250.text: I never thought I'd see this. The Harper and the idiot ranger brought to their knees before me.

Sarevok_Trial_65.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_65.text: I never thought I'd see this. The Grand Harper, brought to her knees before me.

Sarevok_Trial_461.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_461.text: The violence pleases Bhaal. The domination pleases me. Your slaves may stand, the better to bear witness.

Sarevok_Trial_187.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_187.text: You are something truly glorious, child.

Sarevok_Trial_314.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_314.text: But for all your zeal, I sense something... amiss. You stand to be judged as an Unholy Assassin - and yet you bring no offering?

Sarevok_Trial_31.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_31.text: You have earned the right to stand before Bhaal's tribunal.

Sarevok_Trial_293.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_293.text: I never thought I'd see this. The Rashemen wanderer brought to his knees before me.

Sarevok_Trial_327.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_327.text: Such stillness. Such nobility. Unmarked by your command.

Sarevok_Trial_422.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_422.text: Your hubris is quite incredible - but it is your undoing, as it was once mine.

Sarevok_Trial_339.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_339.text: Gesture for a kneel: an act, to see this sham of a ceremony through.

Sarevok_Trial_405.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_405.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira bows before Sarevok.NodeContext: Sigh as you kneel, pretending to be a slave and hating it

Sarevok_Trial_417.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_417.text: Order, and Minsc obeys. As if Boo himself commanded.
Sarevok_Trial_417.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok.NodeContext: Through gritted teeth - playing along with an act you hate

Sarevok_Trial_17.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_17.text: You wished to deceive Sarevok and your allies? The intent pleases, but the execution lacks finesse.

Sarevok_Trial_373.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_373.text: Your hubris has gained the better of you, as mine once did of me. But no more of this act.

Sarevok_Trial_295.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_295.text: They will not bend to your will. No matter - it will be my pleasure to break you, instead. In my Father's name.

Sarevok_Trial_40.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_40.text: She will not bend to your will. No matter - it will be my pleasure to break you both, instead. In my Father's name.

Sarevok_Trial_60.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_60.text: He will not bend to your will. No matter - it will be my pleasure to break you both, instead. In my Father's name.

Sarevok_Trial_459.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_459.text: Fine, Sarevok. If they won't obey - take them as offerings instead.

Sarevok_Trial_311.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_311.text: Fine, Sarevok. If she won't obey - take her as my offering instead.

Sarevok_Trial_171.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_171.text: Fine, Sarevok. If he won't obey - take him as my offering instead.

Sarevok_Trial_379.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_379.text: Minsc politely declines your offer to be an offering. I am afraid he is already claimed by Boo.
Sarevok_Trial_379.context: NodeContext: Grim - we've just offered him to Sarevok as a sacrifice. He's going to fight to the death.

Sarevok_Trial_522.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_522.text: You toss allies aside so easily, after everything? If you are so eager to join this worm, then may you both be buried here together.
Sarevok_Trial_522.context: NodeContext: First line is bitter realization. Then grim resignation - she's getting ready to fight us to the death.

Sarevok_Trial_150.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_150.text: This is a sacrifice my father has long lusted for. But it is not the giving of their lives that will please Bhaal - it is the taking.

Sarevok_Trial_51.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_51.text: The Tribunal bears witness, aspirant - do not disappoint us.

Sarevok_Trial_181.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_181.text: No fooling you, Sarevok. We were actually just deciding which of us should get to kill you.

Sarevok_Trial_362.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_362.text: I know this one well. I have travelled in his company. Whatever else may be said of him, he answers to no one but Boo.

Sarevok_Trial_388.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_388.text: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Minsc answers to me. He won't be a problem.

Sarevok_Trial_69.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_69.text: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Jaheira answers to me. She won't be a problem.

Sarevok_Trial_410.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_410.text: I brought these two here as offerings for Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_413.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_413.text: I brought Minsc here as an offering for Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_192.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_192.text: I brought Jaheira here as an offering for Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_18.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_18.text: We'll find a third way. Would you two like to kill the old man, or shall I?

Sarevok_Trial_225.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_225.text: We'll find a third way. Would you like to kill the old man, Jaheira, or shall I?

Sarevok_Trial_106.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_106.text: We'll find a third way. Would you two like to kill the old man, Minsc, or shall I?

Sarevok_Trial_246.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_246.text: Do not parley with this madman.

Sarevok_Trial_253.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_253.text: Sarevok reclaimed his soul, once - and he still traded it back to his father for a pat on the head. He has earned his second death even more than his first.

Sarevok_Trial_361.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_361.text: Let us pave our own path. Starting with the kicked buttocks of that one there.

Sarevok_Trial_479.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_479.text: Sarevok once had his chance to taste of goodness - but he spat it back out. Now he may taste boot-leather instead.

Sarevok_Trial_212.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_212.text: Would you two like to kill the old man, or shall I?

Sarevok_Trial_249.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_Trial_249.text: You get to my age, you have already done everything. Be my guest.

Sarevok_Trial_286.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_286.text: We have already smashed Sarevok's soul from his body once. Boo says it is your turn.

Sarevok_Trial_272.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_272.text: And so the Harper and the idiot ranger raise their weapons against Sarevok once more.

Sarevok_Trial_310.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_310.text: Would you like to kill the old man, Jaheira, or shall I?

Sarevok_Trial_169.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_169.text: And so the Grand Harper raises her weapons against Sarevok once more.

Sarevok_Trial_4.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_4.text: You disappoint me, child of Bhaal. I had heard such tales of you - tales of grandeur, and vile glory.

Sarevok_Trial_140.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_140.text: But the company you keep has tainted you, and pulled you from our Father's grace.

Sarevok_Trial_282.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_282.text: I understand. I once fell to hubris, as you are falling now. But no more.

Sarevok_Trial_521.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_521.text: Bhaal will never again have cause to question my devotion.

Sarevok_Trial_143.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_143.text: You will die as you have lived, a heretic, forgotten, and unloved. Blood to blood is Bhaal's sacrifice. And I shall be the knife that spills it.

Sarevok_Trial_93.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_93.text: Would you like to kill the old man, Minsc, or shall I?

Sarevok_Trial_72.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_72.text: And so the idiot ranger raises his weapon against Sarevok once more.

Sarevok_Trial_427.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_427.text: Your hubris will be your undoing, as it was once mine.

Sarevok_Trial_91.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_91.text: Only this time you will fall. And Bhaal will have his offering - by my hand.

Sarevok_Trial_224.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_224.text: What purpose do you have in bringing this heretic to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.

Sarevok_Trial_299.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_299.text: As you stood a statue, Stone Lord, a helpless ornament, your city changed. Warped. Became ripe for the plucking.

Sarevok_Trial_113.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_Trial_113.text: While you wriggled 'neath the city's soil like the worm that you are. It will please my hamster to kill you twice, Sarevok.

Sarevok_Trial_183.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_183.text: But you are no mere aspirant. I did not expect to see you again. So it is true. You have returned.

Sarevok_Trial_328.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_328.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A relic of your cursed line, a Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen.*

Sarevok_Trial_508.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_508.text: You seem to know me. Have we met before?

Sarevok_Trial_49.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_49.text: In times past I was Bhaal's Deathbringer - his acolyte. And you, his favourite child.

Sarevok_Trial_88.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_88.text: You worshipped Him the way that he would wish - your blood-lust innate, your thirst for butchery unslakable.

Sarevok_Trial_511.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_511.text: But you were foolish enough to think yourself untouchable. You didn't see Orin rising through the ranks.

Sarevok_Trial_180.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_180.text: You were blinded by her artistry, her devotion - you believed she worshipped you as much as all the others.

Sarevok_Trial_493.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_493.text: Your fall was as spectacular as your birth - the purest Bhaalspawn there ever was, ruined by their own hubris.

Sarevok_Trial_218.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_218.text: But now, you have returned. Tell me, are you here to have your vengeance on my granddaughter?

Sarevok_Trial_66.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_66.text: I've come to slay her. Where is she?

Sarevok_Trial_48.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_48.text: I see why Orin spoke of you with daggered spite.

Sarevok_Trial_451.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_451.text: But this is not her dwelling place. Orin resides within our Father's Temple.

Sarevok_Trial_34.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_34.text: She is the child of my child, and your blood kin.

Sarevok_Trial_504.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_504.text: But she only seeks the Bhaalian favour you were born to inherit.

Sarevok_Trial_239.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_239.text: If I don't recall my past, what need have I of vengeance?

Sarevok_Trial_495.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_495.text: Orin only seeks the Bhaalian favour you were born to inherit.

Sarevok_Trial_234.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_234.text: No, Sarevok - I am here to slay you.

Sarevok_Trial_446.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_446.text: O noisome Child, it would bring waves of enlightened rapture to duel you, but it is impossible now.

Sarevok_Trial_505.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_505.text: I have already been sacrificed, centuries ago, upon Bhaal's own graven altar. I am now but a shadow of my former self.

Sarevok_Trial_445.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_445.text: Orin is the one you seek to butcher. She only seeks the Bhaalian favour you were born to inherit.

Sarevok_Trial_356.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_356.text: She may have usurped you once, but all her rites and rituals will never match her to your natural gift.

Sarevok_Trial_350.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_350.text: Bhaal is about to name a new Chosen. All is between you and my granddaughter Orin now, and Orin has much to learn.

Sarevok_Trial_159.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_159.text: Our lord does not care for beauty. Bhaal cares only for death. Death in numbers. Death in droves.

Sarevok_Trial_115.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_115.text: It is a lesson Orin will only learn in death. I wonder if you will be the one to teach her?

Sarevok_Trial_157.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_157.text: She has already challenged me herself. We will duel to the death.

Sarevok_Trial_226.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_226.text: She seeks to sacrifice you in our Father's temple.

Sarevok_Trial_230.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_230.text: She dreams that your corpse will be her masterpiece, but she forgets - before your incident, you were the true master.

Sarevok_Trial_429.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_429.text: You were murder. Pure murder. No excesses. No pretentions.

Sarevok_Trial_209.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_209.text: I believe you will be the one to slay Orin.

Sarevok_Trial_331.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_331.text: And when you do, remember grandfather Sarevok. Remember how he helped you. Return to visit him, and tell the blood-drenched tale of your victory.

Sarevok_Trial_323.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_323.text: But you will need my help.

Sarevok_Trial_165.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_165.text:
I see you have not embraced your birthright yet. Perhaps with my stewardship,
Father will bless you yet.

Sarevok_Trial_358.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_358.text: And when he does, remember grandfather Sarevok. Remember how he helped you. Return to visit him, and tell the blood-drenched tale of your victory.

Sarevok_Trial_419.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_419.text: Before you may return to our Father's fold, I must first ensure that you remain as pure and worthy of his blessing as you once were.

Sarevok_Trial_449.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_449.text: So I ask -  why have you brought no offering, child of Bhaal? How am I to lead you in his worship, if you abstain from his most blessed sacrement?

Sarevok_Trial_424.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_424.text: Before you may return to our Father's fold, I must first ensure that you remain as pure and worthy of his blessing as you once were.

Sarevok_Trial_137.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_137.text: Come, child of Murder, let me lead you in Bhaal's worship.

Sarevok_Trial_497.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_497.text: I am the very Spawn of Bhaal. I need no leading.

Sarevok_Trial_283.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_283.text: Forgive me, child of Bhaal. I forget myself.

Sarevok_Trial_139.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_139.text: We have a sacrifice prepared for you, child of Murder. Let us celebrate your becoming.

Sarevok_Trial_260.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_260.text: I sense truth to your words - arrogance, too. Bhaal's children must also learn from him. I had to.

Sarevok_Trial_365.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_365.text: You must be tested, Child. It is Bhaal's will.

Sarevok_Trial_376.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_376.text: But I do bring an offering, Sarevok. You've already met Minsc and Jaheira.

Sarevok_Trial_142.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_142.text: But I do bring an offering, Sarevok. You've already met Jaheira.

Sarevok_Trial_296.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_296.text: But I do bring an offering, Sarevok. You've already met Minsc.

Sarevok_Trial_290.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_290.text: I will not worship Bhaal. Though I am his spawn, he is no father of mine.

Sarevok_Trial_206.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_206.text: Do you hear that, child? The bloodless vacuum where your Father's love for you should be. You have disappointed him.

Sarevok_Trial_273.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_273.text: You will make a fine offering to the Lord of Murder - his own blood, returned to him, freed of its ungrateful flesh.

Sarevok_Trial_516.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_516.text: Wrong, Sarevok. I will lead his worship - you will be my offering to Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_418.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_418.text: I'll happily challenge her. Where is she?

Sarevok_Trial_94.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_94.text: I came here to become an Unholy Assassin, not to clean up after your offspring, Sarevok.

Sarevok_Trial_67.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_67.text: And yet you share a Father - her relation to you is as strong as it is to me, blood kin. Perhaps stronger.

Sarevok_Trial_266.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_266.text: I have heard of the duel Orin proposed to you. She seeks to sacrifice you in our Father's temple.

Sarevok_Trial_109.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_109.text: If you think she needs to be taught a lesson, why don't you teach her yourself?

Sarevok_Trial_255.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_255.text: We fought already. She bested me, humiliated me, enclosed me in this chamber with Bhaal's unending disappointment. I am a failure to Him.

Sarevok_Trial_90.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_90.text: But you - your blood is purer than mine ever was. He made you himself. The perfect killer.

Sarevok_Trial_526.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_526.text: You want me to kill your own granddaughter?

Sarevok_Trial_202.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_202.text: She wronged me. In killing her, you honour our Father with a eulogy of blood.

Sarevok_Trial_195.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_195.text: I shall gladly step aside for Orin. I have no interest in pursuing Bhaal's favour.

Sarevok_Trial_352.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_352.text: Why do you speak such heresy, child? Bhaal may favour you yet. You are the true inheritor after all.

Sarevok_Trial_108.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_108.text: Tell me of my past, I wish to know it.

Sarevok_Trial_19.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_19.text: I have heard it said you lost your memories. Let me revive them.

Sarevok_Trial_203.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_203.text: You were once Bhaal's favourite. You worshipped Him the way that he would wish - your blood-lust innate, your thirst for butchery unslakable.

Sarevok_Trial_335.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_335.text: Are you the one behind the murders in the city?

Sarevok_Trial_447.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_447.text: The murders are a test. One that you would once have excelled in, but it is not for you.

Sarevok_Trial_444.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_444.text: I wish to become an Unholy Assassin - show me the way.

Sarevok_Trial_395.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_395.text: Patience, child. Our Father has much in store for you.

Sarevok_Trial_502.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_502.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen, long ago. A spilled stain of Father's Divine Essence left out to dry.*

Sarevok_Trial_13.speaker: Narrator
Sarevok_Trial_13.text: *Is he your cousin? Great-uncle? Brother, even? Bhaal's bilious waters are always a little murky.*

Sarevok_Trial_210.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_210.text: But you do not belong here. You have brought no offering. You are not fit to be judged.

Sarevok_Trial_9.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_9.text: I do not murder innocents. I save them.

Sarevok_Trial_368.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_368.text: Your failure is known to the Lord of Murder. Your sentence is decreed.

Sarevok_Trial_205.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_205.text: Come, dread sisters. Let us make a sacrifice of this pretender, for Bhaal will have his offering.

Sarevok_Trial_16.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_16.text: I couldn't bring myself to harvest body parts. Not even for a god.

Sarevok_Trial_126.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_126.text: What offering was I supposed to bring?

Sarevok_Trial_421.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_421.text: It matters not, for you have entered empty-handed. Your sentence is decreed.

Sarevok_Trial_222.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_222.text: Debasing Bhaal's enemies wasn't enough? Fine. Let Minsc and Jaheira be my offerings.

Sarevok_Trial_302.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_302.text: Debasing Bhaal's enemies wasn't enough? Fine. Let Jaheira be my offering.

Sarevok_Trial_285.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_285.text: Debasing Bhaal's enemies wasn't enough? Fine. Let Minsc be my offering.

Sarevok_Trial_354.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_354.text: Does the fact that I killed Bhaal's own Chosen - Orin - not count for anything?

Sarevok_Trial_3.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_3.text: Orin sent me here to be baptised by Bhaal. Does her word count for nothing?

Sarevok_Trial_465.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_465.text: I can make an offering right now by killing you.

Sarevok_Trial_42.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_42.text: Slow thy tongue, dread sister of mine. This pretender would foist itself upon us willingly, ill-met, but no stranger to slaughter.

Sarevok_Trial_513.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_513.text: Let us make a sacrifice of it, for Bhaal will have his offering.

Sarevok_Trial_12.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_12.text: Sarevok Anchev. How are you still alive?

Sarevok_Trial_104.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_104.text: A long while ago, my wretched sibling brought me back. The fairest of Bhaalspawn, soul-bound me to this husk.

Sarevok_Trial_340.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_340.text: Worship death though I do, I refused it. I roamed the Coast, gathering those who still held Bhaal in their black hearts.

Sarevok_Trial_53.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_53.text: The cult survived, festering beneath the city, with me as the Gate's everlasting poison.

Sarevok_Trial_112.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_112.text: But no more. For poison is too slow a death. Now is the time for slaughter.

Sarevok_Trial_349.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_349.text: With these killings, the glory of the Bhaalists has risen beyond what we dreamed possible during those dark days.

Sarevok_Trial_514.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_514.text: But the worship of my Lord is led by another now - my granddaughter, Orin.

Sarevok_Trial_220.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_220.text: The youngest Unholy Assassin ever to follow in Bhaal's bloody trail. And his Chosen.

Sarevok_Trial_318.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_318.text: What does Orin have to do with the murders in the city?

Sarevok_Trial_416.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_416.text: She is the architect of Bhaal's design.

Sarevok_Trial_269.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_269.text: My very blood, and by extension, His.

Sarevok_Trial_155.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_155.text: How does it feel to be surpassed by your own grandchild?

Sarevok_Trial_149.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_149.text: I'm looking for Orin. Is she here?

Sarevok_Trial_176.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_176.text: I'm looking for Orin. Where can I find her?

Sarevok_Trial_24.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_24.text: I'd like to meet Orin. Where can I find her?

Sarevok_Trial_127.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_127.text: She worships at the heart of Bhaal's domain - the temple of our Lord.

Sarevok_Trial_381.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_381.text: Bhaal has never had a more gifted prodigy.

Sarevok_Trial_152.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_152.text: Orin's gift surpassed even her mother's. Her mother knew this, and she could not bear it.

Sarevok_Trial_431.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_431.text: When Orin was but seven years old, she tried to smother the child as an offering to our Lord.

Sarevok_Trial_244.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_244.text: I heard the screams, I ran to help, afeared for the child's life. But the cries were not Orin's.

Sarevok_Trial_389.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_389.text: It was her mother's blood that soaked the sheets. Orin had cut off the very hand that tried to end her, and made a plaything of it.

Sarevok_Trial_146.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_146.text: And as she toyed with her dead mother's hand, a deep quiver rose up through her throat - the Lord of Murder speaking through the child.

Sarevok_Trial_399.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_399.text: 'Lay not a finger on this child,' he said, 'nor let any other, for this child will serve me with unholy ardour. Protect her, in my name.'

Sarevok_Trial_47.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_47.text: That's horrible. No child should have to go through that.

Sarevok_Trial_22.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_22.text: This was Orin's tribunal. She was judged, and she was found exceptional.

Sarevok_Trial_111.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_111.text: Did you know that your daughter was planning to kill Orin?

Sarevok_Trial_496.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_496.text: I knew of my daughter's ambitions, but not the lengths to which she'd go.

Sarevok_Trial_75.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_75.text: She hungered for Bhaal's favour more than anyone I'd ever known. But her daughter, Orin, hungered even more.

Sarevok_Trial_343.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_343.text: But Orin is not the subject of our judgement here today.

Sarevok_Trial_25.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_25.text: You wish to become an Unholy Assassin of Bhaal. So, approach and be judged.

Sarevok_Trial_0.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_0.text: I am ready to be judged.

Sarevok_Trial_500.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_500.text: Our Father does not feel pride. He bore the disgrace of creating life in his Spawn. We can but atone for the shame of birth.

Sarevok_Trial_333.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_333.text: You misunderstand the Lord of Murder. He is not proud. He simply is.

Sarevok_Trial_86.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_86.text: Spirit of the slaughtered - return to us.

Sarevok_Trial_213.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_213.text: Show us the achievements this child has accomplished in thy unholy name.

Sarevok_Trial_119.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Sarevok_Trial_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: The non-sarevok members of the tribunal lend their powers to sarevok - perhaps one hand to the temple, one outstretched towards sarevok?

Sarevok_Trial_469.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sarevok reaches out his hand, and clenches it as though grasping something tight. He pulls the hand back towards himself, and a roiling, miasma of dark magic streams from off stage into a large cloud in front of the tribunal

Sarevok_Trial_492.context: CinematicNodeContext: the cloud of dark energy clears. The spectre of our previous victim stands before the player. It is confused, scared, and tries to speak, but no noise escapes.

Sarevok_Trial_5.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
Sarevok_Trial_5.text: Can it be - Belynne herself, reduced to a spectre...
Sarevok_Trial_5.context: NodeContext: telepathic, voice in head only

Sarevok_Trial_247.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_247.text: You took this spirit's life, and thus, its voice. So, speak for it. How was this pitiable creature slain?

Sarevok_Trial_391.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_391.text: First, I ended its sorry existence. Then, I cut the hand from its corpse.

Sarevok_Trial_28.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_28.text: The deed is done - the details don't matter.

Sarevok_Trial_147.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_147.text: The details are everything. Anyone can kill - not everyone can make murder an act of worship.

Sarevok_Trial_214.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_214.text: I would have thought you understood that, Bhaalspawn. I am disappointed.

Sarevok_Trial_177.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_177.text: You shrink from that which you should revel in. Your devotion to your Father is wanting.

Sarevok_Trial_402.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_402.text: You shrink from that which you should revel in - it is in revelry that your devotion to the Lord of Murder is known.

Sarevok_Trial_232.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_232.text: An Unholy Assassin of Bhaal has victims, not adversaries.

Sarevok_Trial_430.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_430.text: A victim does not know honour, a victim knows terror and pain.

Sarevok_Trial_35.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_35.text: First, I ended its sorry existence. Then, I cut the hand from its corpse.

Sarevok_Trial_300.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_300.text: You bear his blood well, child. Your offering pleases Father.

Sarevok_Trial_357.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_357.text: You are ripe for rebirth in his unholy name.

Sarevok_Trial_73.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_73.text: We have a sacrifice prepared for you, child of Murder. Let us celebrate your becoming.

Sarevok_Trial_164.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_164.text: Your offering pleases Lord Bhaal. Your words delight him.

Sarevok_Trial_367.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_367.text: You slaughter well, aspirant. You are deemed - worthy.

Sarevok_Trial_471.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_471.text: Enter the Dread Lord's abattoir, and submit to his will.

Sarevok_Trial_198.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_198.text: Your words stumble. They hesitate. You lie.

Sarevok_Trial_486.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_486.text: You will make a most beautiful offering to the Lord of Murder.

Sarevok_Trial_512.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_512.text: Slowly and painfully. I savoured every scream.

Sarevok_Trial_510.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_510.text: With a smile on my face, and pleasure in my heart.

Sarevok_Trial_184.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_184.text: First, I ended its sorry existence. Then, I cut the hand from its corpse.

Sarevok_Trial_433.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_433.text: Slowly and painfully. I savoured every scream.

Sarevok_Trial_525.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_525.text: With a smile on my face, and pleasure in my heart.

Sarevok_Trial_36.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_36.text: With a smile on my face, and pleasure in my heart.

Sarevok_Trial_160.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_160.text: Slowly and painfully. I savoured every scream.

Sarevok_Trial_200.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_200.text: I didn't kill this person. But I will kill you.

Sarevok_Trial_217.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_217.text: Show us the truth of this murderer's intent, and let us judge them for their bloody service.

Sarevok_Trial_81.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_81.text: What does this judgement involve exactly?

Sarevok_Trial_251.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_251.text: There is no better mirror in which to see the true nature of a killer than their victim.

Sarevok_Trial_491.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_491.text: You took their hands from them. Now, I will clutch one of their souls from the Abyss that they may show Bhaal who you are.

Sarevok_Trial_398.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_398.text: I have no interest in being judged by Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_509.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_509.text: This is where you reveal yourself.

Sarevok_Trial_426.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_426.text: I'll approach and take your head, monster.

Sarevok_Trial_466.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_466.text: Your granddaughter killed your daughter? Your family sounds deeply disturbed.

Sarevok_Trial_78.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_78.text: I can see why Bhaal chose Orin.

Sarevok_Trial_96.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_96.text: Bhaal's reasons are not for us to question.

Sarevok_Trial_353.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_353.text: My Lord made his choice - I abided by his words.

Sarevok_Trial_329.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_329.text: And so it is that Orin now leads his Temple, and draws aspirants to his creed.

Sarevok_Trial_280.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_280.text: You should have killed Orin for what she did.

Sarevok_Trial_64.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_64.text: I didn't come here to become embroiled in your family drama - I came here to be baptised by Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_315.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_315.text: Very well. Then approach, and be judged.

Sarevok_Trial_515.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_515.text: That's quite a story. Shame I had to kill Orin.

Sarevok_Trial_394.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_394.text: You? You have slain Bhaal's Chosen?

Sarevok_Trial_259.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_259.text: Then your devotion to the Murder Lord is unparalleled. And I am in your debt. For you have done me a great service. You have cleared the way for my return.

Sarevok_Trial_494.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_494.text: I will be the Dread Lord's Chosen once again. And you will be my offering.

Sarevok_Trial_408.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_408.text: I don't care about Orin - I came here to be baptised by Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_237.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_237.text: I know Orin. I killed her.

Sarevok_Trial_52.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_52.text: Are you the reason there are so many murders in the city?

Sarevok_Trial_263.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_263.text: In times past I was Bhaal's Deathbringer - his acolyte. But no more.

Sarevok_Trial_103.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_103.text: My Lord has a new favourite now. My granddaughter, Orin.
Sarevok_Trial_103.context: NodeContext: with resentment - he thinks the Chosen should be him

Sarevok_Trial_133.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_133.text: I want to become an Unholy Assassin. What must I do?

Sarevok_Trial_158.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_158.text: A test. To prove your worth to Bhaal.

Sarevok_Trial_37.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_37.text: Orin sent me here to be baptised by Bhaal. What must I do?

Sarevok_Trial_488.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_488.text: My granddaughter sent you? A  rapturous endorsement indeed, for she is the Murder Lord's new favourite.

Sarevok_Trial_68.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_68.text: What exactly is an Unholy Assassin?

Sarevok_Trial_46.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_46.text: A servant to the cause. A master of the craft.

Sarevok_Trial_411.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_411.text: They are the executioners of Bhaal's will, and slaughter in His name.

Sarevok_Trial_261.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_261.text: I already killed Orin, what more must I do?

Sarevok_Trial_443.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_443.text: What does this have to do with the murders in the city?

Sarevok_Trial_125.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_125.text: That is not for you to question.

Sarevok_Trial_241.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_241.text: Then what purpose do you serve, Sarevok?

Sarevok_Trial_507.speaker: Player
Sarevok_Trial_507.text: I have no business with Bhaal, I'll leave.

Sarevok_Trial_148.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_148.text: You are mistaken. An offering must be made.

Sarevok_Trial_355.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_355.text: The Dread Lord will have his tribute - the blood spilled will be yours.

Sarevok_Trial_472.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_472.text: A pleasing thing, to see these stones stained with the blood of those who disgraced my Father.

Sarevok_Trial_207.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_207.text: I know my like, child of Bhaal - but I needed to see you slaughter, first. To take life and revel in it.

Sarevok_Trial_499.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_Trial_499.text: Are you here to have your vengeance on my granddaughter, Orin?

DeathKnight_14.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_14.text:
A battle won, a rival slain.
His blood runs thick, a worthy stain.

DeathKnight_16.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_16.text:
Thou hast shown proof of worthy kill.
Present thyself before Bhaal's will.

DeathKnight_21.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_21.text:
A chosen butcher walks anew.
Thou standest 'mongst a bloody few.

DeathKnight_29.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_29.text:
Present me well from gifts thine own,
Or I shall rend thy flesh from bone.

DeathKnight_28.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_28.text: I killed to be here - and took the victim's hand as proof.

DeathKnight_11.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_11.text:
A grasping hand, an offering vile...
