Enter now the Dread Lord's Trial.

DeathKnight_4.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_4.text:
Thine offering is doomed to lack,
So face a fate most bleak and black.

DeathKnight_22.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_22.text: I offer myself. There is no finer offering than the poison fruit of Bhaal's loins.

DeathKnight_34.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_34.text: You seek me. Let me pass.

DeathKnight_18.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_18.text: I've got several powerful magic artefacts you can take.

DeathKnight_6.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_6.text: How about some gold? I've got plenty.

DeathKnight_32.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_32.text: I care not for what you seek. Stand aside.

DeathKnight_23.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_23.text: Ugh. Father's servants are such a bore. Let me through!

DeathKnight_2.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_2.text:
To passions brash thou art a slave.
This sinful ground shall be thy grave.

DeathKnight_33.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_33.text: I can't rend your flesh, but I can dent your metal.

DeathKnight_30.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_30.text: I don't want to give you the wrong answer. Can I have some time to think?

DeathKnight_12.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_12.text: Grant unto me a touch more time / To ponder on your cunning rhyme.

DeathKnight_9.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_9.text:
Return to me with what I seek,
Or face a fate most black and bleak.

DeathKnight_26.speaker: That Which Guards
DeathKnight_26.text:
Thou walkest 'pon unhallowed ground,
A place your corpse will not be found.

DeathKnight_25.speaker: Player
DeathKnight_25.text: I am preparing a triumphant offering, grant me more time to make it glorious.

AD_DeathKnight_Combat001_0.speaker: That Which Guards
AD_DeathKnight_Combat001_0.text: Join the Dread Lord's fell embrace.

AD_Valeria_Attacked_0.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Attacked_0.text: AGH! Citizen, stop this at ONCE!

AD_Valeria_Attacked_1.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Attacked_1.text: Someone'll stop you, Bhaalist. When they do, I hope it hurts.

AD_Valeria_Attacked_2.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Attacked_2.text: T-try me without these chains on, coward!

AD_Valeria_Attacked_5.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Attacked_5.text: Watch where you're swinging that thing!

AD_Valeria_Attacked_6.speaker: Valeria
AD_Valeria_Attacked_6.text: No, hit them, not ME, YOU COLOSSAL TWAT!

AD_Sarevok_DeathBringerAssault_3.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_DeathBringerAssault_3.text: Yield - to the wrath of Bhaal!

AD_Dolor_DeathKnight_1.speaker: That Which Guards
AD_Dolor_DeathKnight_1.text:
You may not pass until you face
They who seek to take your place.

AD_Dolor_DeathKnight_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_DeathKnight_0.text: 'Take my place' - what are you talking about? Who? Blasted wraith...

AD_Baptism_Cultists_0.speaker: Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost

AD_Baptism_Cultists_1.speaker: Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost, Tribunal Ghost

PAD_BecameUnholyAssassin_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BecameUnholyAssassin_0.text: Unholy Assassin. Does have a certain... ring to it.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_9.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_9.text: Go, berserker. Do as you do best - but this time in the name of Murder.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_26.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_26.text: Stumble on, Rasheman wanderer... murder well in His name.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_28.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_28.text: Slaughter deeply, aspirant, then bathe in the font of blood. The Murder Lord awaits your offering.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_28.context: InternalNodeContext: Valeria present, but not yet killed by player in gameplay

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_41.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_41.text: Walk in blood, Unholy Assassin. It is Lord Bhaal's will.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_61.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_61.text: Do not keep your Father waiting. Slaughter first, then cleanse yourself in blood.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_64.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_64.text: Why do you wait, child of Murder? Bathe now in the font of blood and receive your Father's blessing.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_69.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_69.text: You wear our Lord's will well. Go forth and render murder in his name.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_76.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_76.text: Come, child of Bhaal. Offer thanks unto your father for your birth, and in so doing, be reborn anew.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_79.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_79.text: Slaughter this celestial being. Spill its blood into the void and through eradication of its goodness, be exalted.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_78.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_78.text: You stand now on the cusp of the Dread Lord's favour.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_260.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_260.text: You have proven capable of killing those known to you, but true devotion is the killing of an innocent. One who never had reason to wrong you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_138.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_138.text: One who dies for no other reason than the sanctity of slaughter.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_184.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_184.text: Kill this celestial being, make violence of its goodness, and you will be reborn - an Unholy Assassin of Bhaal.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_150.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_150.text: One killing secures your rebirth as an Unholy Assassin of Bhaal - the slaughter of a celestial being.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_73.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_73.text: Make violence of its goodness. Spill its blood, and bathe in Bhaal's eternal rapture.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_218.speaker: Valeria
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_218.text: Oi, I know you! Do not listen to this ancient fuck. Free me at once.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_8.speaker: Valeria
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_8.text: Civilian, do not listen to this ancient fuck. Free me at once.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_39.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_39.text: Remember. We are here to find our way into Bhaal's Temple. Not to enter his service in truth.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_39.context: NodeContext: Pitched low to player alone - we are playing the role of Bhaal's faithful as an act, we can't get lost in it

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_251.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_251.text: It shall play a symphony of screams with its trumpet!

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_250.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_250.text: To strangle it with its own trunk! Yes... Yes!

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_55.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_55.text: It will make a fine pair of ivory daggers.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_22.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_22.text: I will sacrifice the creature to Bhaal.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_271.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_271.text: Spare no violence for the Dread Lord's grace. And savour every moment of the creature's slaughter.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_7.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_7.text: Blood will be spilt, Sarevok. I will slaughter you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_54.text: Feisty little creature. If you hold it down, I will slice off its trunk.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_142.speaker: Karlach
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_142.text: This is grim. If we can slip this without murdering a hollyphant, I'll be very glad.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_188.speaker: Lae'zel
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_188.text: Chk. Would you be so cowardly as to do the bidding of this turgid dread-lord?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_192.speaker: Lae'zel
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_192.text: Chk. Any sacrifice we make must be for my venerable queen, not this turgid dread-lord.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_200.speaker: Wyll
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_200.text: Outrageous. If Bhaal demands blood, you cannot, you must not, be the one to spill it for him.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_234.speaker: Shadowheart
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_234.text: This is Bhaal's sacrifice...? Wouldn't have been my first guess. Or my tenth.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_234.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_263.speaker: Gale
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_263.text: I never credited Bhaal with a sense of humour. This is some sick joke of his - let's not be part of it.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_264.speaker: Astarion
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_264.text: This is the grand sacrifice demanded by Bhaal? This?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_265.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_265.text: This leathered balloon is bound. Helpless. If there must be blood spilled on this floor, Boo has some better ideas of who it should belong to.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_265.context: NodeContext: Pitched low, urgent - Minsc doesn't want to sacrifice the hollyphant, he wants to kill Sarevok instead

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_270.speaker: Halsin
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_270.text: This is the sacrifice that Bhaal demands? I had expected something more... auspicious, perhaps.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_270.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The sacrifice is a hollyphant, a small, cute talking elephant with wings

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_177.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_177.text: I failed once to kill my kin. Now, at last may I offer family blood to the Lord.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_1.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_1.text: You will make a most beautiful offering to the Lord of Murder.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_105.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_105.text: You slaughtered well. Your worth is proven. Enter now the font of blood and be reborn.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_105.context: InternalNodeContext: Valeria not present at all - player killed her already prior to Murder Tribunal.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_123.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_123.text: Take pleasure in your slaughters, Harper, and relish your unholy acts of murder.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_131.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_131.text: Behold Father Bhaal! Your lost child, bathed anew. Arise, Unholy Assassin!
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player walk into the pool of blood, submerging themselves

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_284.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_284.text: HIS MOST UNHOLY WILL BE DONE.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see a shot of the player emerging from the blood, it cascades down from their face. We see them open their eyes: pitch black. They blink once, and their eyes are normal again.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_247.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_247.text: Yes, Boo - Sarevok does speak like one who has not tasted Minsc's boot on his brow before. You will recall we killed you once before, Bhaalspawn.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_120.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_120.text: And yet I returned to my Father's service, and brought you with me, Rasheman wanderer. For in your baptism are we united under Bhaal.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_283.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_283.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron-strings?
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_283.context: NodeContext: Jeering - she's meeting an old enemy from the previous games

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_77.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_77.text: No more than you are, Harper. For you have been reborn. And in our service are we united, Unholy Assassin.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_206.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_206.text: Another walks in Bhaal's bloody footsteps. It seems your warnings were not heeded, 'heroes' of Baldur's Gate.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_237.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_237.text: I must admit it brings me pleasure to baptise an Unholy Assassin in your presence, noble heroes.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_115.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_115.text: Do not presume any would follow your path, Sarevok. After all, you've shown them its sad and meaningless end.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_115.context: NodeContext: Scorn for Sarevok, pushing back on the notion that he's won by influence the player. Gesturing at the sad and dark surrounds on last line.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_36.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_36.text: Our friend is not like you were, Sarevok. When Boo speaks to them of goodness, they does not get that stupid, soon-to-sneeze look on their face, as you used to.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_21.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_21.text: A word of advice, Unholy Assassin - wrap your leash tighter about your slaves, lest their belligerence undoes you.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_21.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, with fatherly tone, as one Bhaalist to another

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_17.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_17.text: The reasons matter not. The celestial is dead. The offering is made.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_17.context: NodeContext: authoritative, addressing the room at large

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_122.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_122.text: The discards of history may yet find their true purpose in Bhaal's service.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_40.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_40.text: Take this amulet, child, and return it to your Father's chamber.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_91.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_91.text: We act with a purpose, Sarevok. Perhaps you have forgotten what that feels like.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_168.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_168.text: Minsc does the doing, Boo the reasoning why - and he need not explain our noble cause to you, smooth-skull.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_18.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_18.text: The Grand Harper - baptised in blood. What a sight to behold.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_258.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_258.text: The hamstered fool - once more stumbling across Bhaal's bloody path.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_232.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_232.text: You always were vulnerable to a grand narrative. Such weakness is common among heroes of your ilk.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_285.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_285.text: It matters not. The celestial is dead. The offering is made.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_285.context: NodeContext: authoritative, addressing the room at large

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_136.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_136.text: Ah, faces I have not beheld for a long time. Nature's warrior and the idiot ranger.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_2.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_2.text: Minsc knows little of irony, but he would be happy to show you his steel again, Sarevok.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_2.context: NodeContext: Saying 'irony' like 'iron' - distaste and anger at seeing Sarevok again

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_245.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_245.text: Child of Bhaal: do you not fear our Father's wrath? Why waste your time on discarded relics? With Bhaal's blood in your veins, you need them not.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_185.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_185.text: Tell me, Unholy Assassin. Why waste your time on discarded relics? With Bhaal's favour you need them not.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_31.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_31.text: They know I am more than my lineage. You do not.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_68.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_68.text: But do not let us keep you from your business. There is so very much sitting and sulking in the darkness to be done.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_71.speaker: Minsc
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_71.text: Boo will leave your innards unfeasted on for now, Sarevok, but only to leave room for the villains who actually matter.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_71.context: NodeContext: Scorn and distaste. As harsh a burn as Minsc can levy

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_280.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_280.text: Your wits remain as sharp as ever. But your devotion must be sharper still - for you now carry the Murder Lord's blessing, Unholy Assassin, and his expectation.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_5.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_5.text: And you will be well-instructed. For you follow a Bhaalspawn.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_93.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_93.text: I bestow upon you the Amulet of Bhaal - the vestment of his most unholy servants.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_48.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_48.text: With this amulet, He grants you entry to His chambers - the undercity Temple of Bhaal.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_210.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_210.text: The portfolio of murder passes into your hands. Do it justice. Enact slaughter befitting a god.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_212.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_212.text: Courting Bhaal's favour is but a means to an end. I am no acolyte of murder.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_98.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_98.text: They are powerful allies - I need all the help I can get.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_273.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_273.text: Yet you still came here - seeking Lord Bhaal's favour.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_27.speaker: Jaheira
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_27.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron-strings?
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_27.context: NodeContext: Jeering - she's meeting an old enemy from the previous games

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_135.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_135.text: Behold, Father. Baptised in your most wretched name: a new Unholy Assassin.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_135.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player walk into the pool of blood, submerging themselves

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_145.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_145.text: Do not test the Murder Lord's patience. Bathe now in the font of blood, and be baptised as His Unholy Assassin.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_145.context: InternalNodeContext: Hasmet for the case where player had already killed Valeria prior to entering the Murder Tribunal (so didn't make the sacrifice in this scene.)

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_146.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_146.text: Today we witness near-perfection, Bhaalspawn. Your blood was foul before, but now you are twice-tarnished - the Unholiest Assassin.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_130.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_130.text: Father shall be proud, indeed. Go to him, and present your sister as an offering. There isn't a moment to lose.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_217.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_217.text: I fell from my position at Bhaal's helm - why am I still worthy to become Chosen?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_0.text: I remember the first time you set foot in the Tribunal. Fallen paladin, coated in the blood of your order. Pure corruption, I knew you would go far.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_102.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_102.text: You don't recall all the wrong you wrought at the Temple, champion of the underworld. But one matter is undeniable:

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_254.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_254.text: You belong to Bhaal. He manifests within you. And you are a truer vessel of his cruelty than even the Slayer could be.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_117.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_117.text: The thwarted dream of two centuries ago - for Father to walk the planes again - you are the one that can revive that dream.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_35.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_35.text: While Bhaal receives tribute through Orin, He lives again through you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_191.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_191.text: I shall be his very body on this world.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_174.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_174.text: Go now, and do what I could not. Go to the heart of slaughter, and be the last to live.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_112.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_112.text: The temple is beneath the city, where all blood spilled is drained.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_162.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_162.text: Take this amulet, child, and return it to your Father's chamber. You are the true inheritor of his will, and he would smile to see you wear it.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_161.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_161.text: Cleanse the temple of Orin's girlish shrines and bring your primal slaughter back to Bhaal.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_25.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_25.text: There is nothing more I can teach you, but if you bring about her death, return to me. We shall revel in the divine memory together, as Family.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_196.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_196.text: Tribute is not enough for our Lord. She dies.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_154.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_154.text: I wish he trusted me to act on my own, without forcing my hand.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_228.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_228.text: Does your body force you to blink? To breathe? To piss?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_223.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_223.text: I fear very greatly when he possesses me.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_70.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_70.text: For you, His perfect creation, it is only natural.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_66.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_66.text: Killing is but another vital function of your existence. Such is the Urge.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_116.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_116.text: I'm surprised you would have me as Chosen, over your own granddaughter.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_213.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_213.text: Do not mistake my blessing. If it is your death that becomes the offering, I would worship that tragedy.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_193.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_193.text: Father loves no sport more than the spillages of fratricide.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_227.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_227.text: Every Bhaalspawn, other than he who would be Chosen, is born to die.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_62.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_62.text: Join me. We shred her together.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_141.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_141.text: The victorious Chosen must emerge from his own knife-arm. Far be it from me to bend Bhaal's will.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_128.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_128.text: I played your game, but I will go no further.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_60.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_60.text: Perhaps your heart has spent too long bleeding. Bhaal will not allow for a moment of weakness.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_230.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_230.text: Very well. But first, I will slaughter you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_24.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_24.text: And so I am exposed to the instincts of a pure Bhaalspawn. I should have known. Yours is a nature not to be contained.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_101.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_101.text: A true pleasure this will be, Bhaalspawn. Whether to kill you or to be killed by you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_147.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_147.text: Come, child of Bhaal. You have wrought exquisite murder. Enter now the font of blood and be purified in sin.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_156.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_156.text: You return, Unholy Assassin, soaked with the stench of one familiar to me...

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_133.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_133.text: You have slain my granddaughter, Orin.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_151.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_151.text: Your talents have outstripped my expectations.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_151.context: NodeContext: impressed when any normal person would be disgusted/upset

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_171.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_171.text: You ordered her own mother to kill her. I simply finished the job.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_108.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_108.text: Poor child, she doted on her grandfather, the only person who tried to protect her when her mother failed to kill her.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_248.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_248.text: I loved her as I loved her mother. One born from the other, both heritors of my essence.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_83.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_83.text: Bhaal never had a more fecund offering than I sowed on his behalf.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_53.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_53.text: Why did you order Orin's mother to kill her?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_65.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_65.text: What better offering to make to our Lord?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_107.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_107.text: Why would you make a child with your own child?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_225.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_225.text: Bhaal's seed must be sown throughout the land that He might wreak murder on the world entire.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_46.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_46.text: No more, Sarevok. It's time someone put an end to you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_164.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_164.text: I should raise a hymnal in your name, child. For the service you have done for me.
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_164.context: NodeContext: pause before he says this with a sickly smile

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_240.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_240.text: By spilling Orin's blood, you rouse an old man's withered passions from their slumber, and clear the way for their awakening.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_23.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_23.text: I will rise again, the Dread Lord's Chosen once again. And you will be my offering.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_207.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_207.text: I told Orin the truth about you - that you ordered her own mother to kill her.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_282.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_282.text: I know the truth, Sarevok. Orin wasn't just your granddaughter. She was your daughter, too.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_127.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_127.text: It is a shame you did not tell her. Orin never knew who her father was. Never knew how potent he could be.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_255.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_255.text: She doted on her grandfather, the only person who tried to protect her when her mother failed to kill her.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_45.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_45.text: I told Orin your secret, Sarevok. That she was both your granddaughter and your daughter. She couldn't bear it.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_63.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_63.text: I sowed the seeds of my intent. It was you that harvested them.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_90.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_90.text: The child of Bhaal who slays the Chosen may himself become Bhaal's Chosen.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_14.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_14.text: Aren't you sad I killed your granddaughter?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_81.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_81.text: Bow before me, Sarevok. I have accomplished more than you ever dreamed of.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_246.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_246.text: You have slaughtered Bhaal's Chosen, yes. But I will not bow to you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_104.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_104.text: Now you may experience my talents firsthand. I am here to kill you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_204.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_204.text: Go now child. Slaughter your sister, Orin. Take your rightful place as Father's heir.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_214.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_214.text: The noble Jaheira - once more walking in Bhaal's bloody footsteps.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_281.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_281.text: You return, taint-blessed kin-killer, having committed the holiest of sins.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_149.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_149.text: Your despicable sister lies dead, and your Chosen body bathed in her blood.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_257.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_257.text: She withered when I told her your truth - that she was to be her mother's sacrifice.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_44.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_44.text: I discovered she was the sire of your own incest. Now your line is ended.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_125.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_125.text: As my daughter raised our daughter, we debated to no end as to how we would make of her the perfect offering to the Dread Lord.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_203.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_203.text: To eat her when she was but a babe? To drain a gallon of her blood each morn and pour it over his icon each night? To skin her, and craft the hide into a hilt for a sacred knife?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_109.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_109.text: I am pleased she died a finer offering yet: there is no deeper honour than death in a duel with Bhaal's Chosen.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_50.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_50.text: You have given me everything a father could hope for.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_287.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_287.text: Pah. All this birth is a distraction. The world over will be dead soon enough.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_15.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_15.text: Even by Bhaal's standards, you're truly vile, uncle.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_13.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_13.text: The family tree is a bit of a circle, isn't it?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_94.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_94.text: You failed to bring forth issue while you helmed our cult. It is a mortal sin for a Chosen.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_220.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_220.text: I even hoped you and my daughter might one day create a new blood-lamb for us, but it is not to be...

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_29.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_29.text: Bhaal below, I really just want to kill you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_183.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_183.text: And, would you know it, little Slayer, so do I you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_221.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_221.text: Genuflect before my divine body, for I am Bhaal's new Chosen.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_179.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_179.text: I did. And now I'm here to bathe this place in yours.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_173.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_173.text: Bhaal's will is absolute. The strongest of his bloodline will be Chosen. A spawn who kills a Chosen must then become Chosen themselves.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_159.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_159.text: You have done me a great service, Child of Murder. In eliminating Orin, you have cleared the way for me.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_88.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_88.text: With your death, will I prove myself anew. It is Father's way.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_163.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_163.text: Come on, I did the work of killing her. I'm the one worth his respect.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_143.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_143.text: And who counselled you to do it?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_182.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_182.text: Who laid a trap for the hot-blooded young Bhaalspawn, and tricked them to return?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_59.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_59.text: I knew the old way. Two feral Bhaalpups, jostling for position at the top. One was going to die by the other's hand.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_129.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_129.text: Thus, one would halve the work, of murdering to the top. They would never consider that another remained yet with a claim upon their title. You didn't even think of it when we spoke earlier.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_202.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_202.text: You don't have a hope in the Hells of defeating me.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_100.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_100.text: That's pure delusion. Bhaal would never anoint you as the Chosen, worm.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_144.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_144.text: Perhaps not, but for his honour, I must try. To die by the hand of a Chosen is the only death I could ever wish to take.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_92.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_92.text: What a treat. Just like your granddaughter was, gargling on her own blood.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_215.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_215.text: My aching bones in this husk still feel every spark of pain from the crystalline moment of my first death, in the Temple.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_269.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_269.text: Let us die, Chosen, as only Bhaalspawn can.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_274.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_274.text: To arms, then. In Bhaal's name.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_20.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_20.text: To receive the Blessing of Bhaal... I lie awake each night, in this sleepless scab of a form... dreaming of what it would have been like.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_181.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_181.text: It must have been. And you have given me new hope yet.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_32.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_32.text: There is much left to do. This world must surrender to him.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_140.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_140.text: You are so full of promise, the perfect Chosen. I almost hate to bring a challenge upon you.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_275.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_275.text: You will never know. You failed.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_74.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_74.text: And every day living with the failure of my first death, I wondered... whether Bhaal might forgive me.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_155.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_155.text: And yet you still live, Sarevok, after all these years.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_198.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_198.text: I died, once. A death in the selfsame temple chamber where you slaughtered Orin.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_194.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_194.text: A long while ago, my wretched sibling brought me back. The fairest of Bhaalspawn, soul-bound me to this husk.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_189.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_189.text: Worship death though I do, I refused it. I roamed the Coast, gathering those who still held Bhaal in their black hearts.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_199.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_199.text: The cult survived, festering beneath the city, with me as the Gate's everlasting poison.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_216.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_216.text: With these killings, the glory of the Bhaalists has risen beyond what we dreamed possible during those dark days.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_67.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_67.text: And now that you have returned, we will have a new age of slaughter in your name. For you have slain Orin in our Father's Temple.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_226.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_226.text: And yet, as you came afore Bhaal, you spat upon the glory all of our brood dream of so deeply.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_229.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_229.text: Leaving Father with no Chosen at all.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_47.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_47.text: You're disgusting, siring a child from your own daughter.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_38.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_38.text: And in the end she died for nothing. By your hand. The whole debacle caused naught but Bhaal's ire.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_195.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_195.text: I'd hoped she would die by the Chosen's hand. But there is no Chosen in this cruel world, and soon I shall be all that remains of his line.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_137.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_137.text: She gave up before she died, when she heard of her mother's hate.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_259.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_259.text: I'm no Bhaalspawn. Not any longer.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_262.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_262.text: For two hundred years, I wallowed in my own failure to dominate this city.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_176.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_176.text: Two hundred years late, but your hold over the Gate ends today.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_175.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_175.text: And I remember my battle for the city like it was yesterday...

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_56.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_56.text: I didn't deserve an eternity of rest, I deserved only this shackle, to live forever on the outskirts of my own dear cult, and mourn my own downfall.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_124.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_124.text: After centuries of this rancid defeat, I rejoice. For today, I meet the true definition of failure.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_167.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_167.text: Bhaal's line should have ended with you, Sarevok - how is it that you still live?

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_10.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_10.text: But you have brought it crashing at our Father's feet. With Orin's death and your rejection of him, you leave him with no Chosen.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_72.speaker: Player
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_72.text: I will be the last of my line.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_148.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_148.text: I will be the last of our line. As long as one Bhaalspawn lives yet, there may be a Chosen.

Sarevok_BloodBaptism_233.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
Sarevok_BloodBaptism_233.text: Perhaps Father will take me back if I clean the world of his little embarrassment.

AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_0.text: Perhaps I erred... No, my victims were all from the list. I am right. I am owed.

AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_1.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_1.text: Let me pass. I have paid my dues - I will stand before the Tribunal. I must.

AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_2.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_2.text: Am I to beg? To plead? To debase myself, wraith? Speak, damn you!

AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_3.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_IdleAtDeathKnight_3.text: I spoke the damned passphrase, brought the bloody hands - let me in!

AD_Dolor_NoDoorKey_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_NoDoorKey_0.text: I have come too far, slain too many, to be foiled by a door.

AD_Sarevok_Combat002_0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_Combat002_0.text: The taste of blood, the tang of death - it has been far too long.

TombstoneShop_Password_6.speaker: Narrator
TombstoneShop_Password_6.text: *The locked door has red text on it reading, 'All are awaited, all are embraced, none shall escape.'*

TombstoneShop_Password_8.speaker: Player
TombstoneShop_Password_8.text: That text is vaguely familiar - try to recall its historical source.

TombstoneShop_Password_16.speaker: Narrator
TombstoneShop_Password_16.text: *That phrase is Bhaalist - this place has some connection to Orin and her cult of killers. You should learn more about them.*

TombstoneShop_Password_13.speaker: Narrator
TombstoneShop_Password_13.text: *The phrase sounds familiar but you can't quite recall where you heard it.*

TombstoneShop_Password_11.speaker: Player
TombstoneShop_Password_11.text: Examine the red symbol blazoned on the door.

TombstoneShop_Password_4.speaker: Narrator
TombstoneShop_Password_4.text: *The reddish symbol is vile and repellent, but you're not sure where you've seen it before.*

TombstoneShop_Password_17.speaker: Narrator
TombstoneShop_Password_17.text: *It reminds you of the symbol people say has been seen at recent ritual murder sites. You should investigate those serial killings.*

TombstoneShop_Password_12.speaker: Narrator
TombstoneShop_Password_12.text: *The door with the red script remains locked. It may open only to a password.*

Dolor_13.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_13.text: I think you are confused, wraith. You speak of another. Who has proven themselves like me? Who has sacrificed what I have? SPEAK!

Dolor_30.speaker: That Which Guards
Dolor_30.text:
The ground doth shake, the air is thin.
Hail, Unholy Assassin.

Dolor_5.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_5.text: I know you... and you are most certainly not a faithful of Bhaal. Not like I am.

Dolor_32.speaker: That Which Guards
Dolor_32.text:
Though folly most unusual,
Just one may seek the Tribunal.

Dolor_31.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_31.text: Fine, I will add this pretender to my many sacrifices in Bhaal's name. May it please the Tribunal.

Dolor_23.speaker: Player
Dolor_23.text: I don't care enough to fight you for it. Go ahead.

Dolor_26.speaker: That Which Guards
Dolor_26.text:
Such weak will dost no Bhaalist make.
This life, young dwarf, is thine to take.

Dolor_11.speaker: Player
Dolor_11.text: That this 'Tribunal' would pit two perfect killers against each other shows it does not serve Bhaal. We should destroy it.

Dolor_36.speaker: Player
Dolor_36.text: Joining forces is the most strategic course of action. Why don't we take down this 'Tribunal' together?

Dolor_28.speaker: Player
Dolor_28.text: I'll give you a choice. Either help me crush this pathetic tribute to Bhaal, or die.

Dolor_8.speaker: Player
Dolor_8.text: I'm going to obliterate this so-called 'Tribunal'. Why not help me? They will rue the day they spurned you in Bhaal's name.

Dolor_29.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_29.text: You're... you're right. Bhaal is not a god of decrees and doctrines.

Dolor_25.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_25.text: He is the Lord of Murder. Let us remind the Tribunal of this.

Dolor_58.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_58.text: No. I will cut the hand from your heretical corpse and bring it before the Tribunal. I will ascend.

Dolor_47.speaker: That Which Guards
Dolor_47.text:
Of thy betters speak not ill.
Thus demands our Lord Bhaal's will.

Dolor_19.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_19.text: Bhaal is a god of murder, not manners. Besides, you would call this weakling my 'better'? Ridiculous.

Dolor_55.speaker: Player
Dolor_55.text: You're the one who's been murdering the targets from the list! Too bad you were too late to claim the prize.

Dolor_24.speaker: Player
Dolor_24.text: I knew I should have killed you the last time we met.

Dolor_50.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_50.text: I'll rip that smarmy tongue out of your head.

Dolor_60.speaker: Player
Dolor_60.text: The Murder Tribunal seemed to think I was pretty good.

Dolor_1.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_1.text: I wonder what they'll think when I bring them the hand cut from your corpse?

Dolor_46.speaker: That Which Guards
Dolor_46.text:
Thou speakest not with reverent zeal -
I'll still thy tongue with Bhaalist steel.

Dolor_16.speaker: Player
Dolor_16.text: Don't get angry - you can polish the Unholy Assassin's boots if you want!

Dolor_15.speaker: Player
Dolor_15.text: I find this dwarf tiresome. It should be disposed of.

Dolor_9.speaker: That Which Guards
Dolor_9.text:
As sure as setting of the sun,
Thine Unholy will be done.

Dolor_17.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_17.text: That title is mine. That you would give it to some indolent civilian is an affront.

Dolor_42.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_42.text: Who is this? Some worthless imitator, no doubt. A forgery.

Dolor_40.speaker: That Which Guards
Dolor_40.text:
We are approached, so still thy rant.
Share you shall in murder's chant.

Dolor_18.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_18.text: I heard that there was another aspirant seeking the Tribunal.

Dolor_39.speaker: Player
Dolor_39.text: You're the one who's been murdering the targets from the list! Too bad you were too late to claim the prize.

Dolor_44.speaker: Player
Dolor_44.text: You again? I knew I should have killed you last time we met.

Dolor_14.speaker: Player
Dolor_14.text: Your ascension isn't happening. I already killed Sarevok, and the rest of the tribunal.

Dolor_21.speaker: Player
Dolor_21.text: Your ascension isn't happening. I already dealt with Sarevok, and the rest of the tribunal.

Dolor_35.speaker: Player
Dolor_35.text: You're right. It's me. I'm the Unholy Assassin. Would you like a demonstration?

Dolor_12.speaker: Player
Dolor_12.text: If you want it that much, don't let me stop you.

Dolor_45.speaker: Meztli
Dolor_45.text: But there can only be one Unholy Assassin. If you think you're getting in the way of my ascension, you are deeply mistaken.

Dolor_4.speaker: Player
Dolor_4.text: So you're the one who's been murdering people. Your killings end here.

Dolor_52.speaker: Player
Dolor_52.text: You can have the title, I'll just leave.

AD_Sarevok_Combat001_0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_Combat001_0.text: I will not tolerate impudence. This place shall be your grave.

AD_Sarevok_OnDeath_0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_OnDeath_0.text: Father... forgive me. I have failed you.

AD_Sarevok_OnDeath_2.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_OnDeath_2.text: I... am not the last... I am but one more offering in Bhaal's name.

AD_Dolor_NoDeathKnight_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_NoDeathKnight_0.text: Another seeks the Tribunal... No. This moment is mine.

Illasera_0.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_0.text: A fresh Unholy Assassin. I remember the feeling - your ambition is to be commended.

Illasera_3.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_3.text: A fresh Unholy Assassin, and one of Bhaal's own blood.

Illasera_31.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_31.text: You are to be commended, though I expected nothing less from a Child of Murder.

Illasera_19.speaker: Player
Illasera_19.text: Who are you to commend me?

Illasera_40.speaker: Player
Illasera_40.text: I don't like it. I feel... tainted.

Illasera_23.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_23.text: It is a spot that will not scrub out.

Illasera_22.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_22.text: You remember... Kneeling afore a bucket. Scrubbing, scrubbing. It never works, does it?

Illasera_20.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_20.text: You are a chosen butcher now, little lamb. You shall lead many to his slaughter - whether you wish to or no.

Illasera_17.speaker: Player
Illasera_17.text: Is there no way for me to loosen Bhaal's hold?

Illasera_29.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_29.text: Haven't you felt it, Holy Child? Bhaal has a noose around your neck. You must trust him, and leap.

Illasera_9.speaker: Player
Illasera_9.text: It is my destiny. I will be the last soul alive in this blighted world.

Illasera_8.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_8.text: I remember when I dreamed of the same.

Illasera_4.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_4.text: I am Illasera the Quick. Child of Bhaal. Slayer of his idle children. Cut down before my time.

Illasera_15.speaker: Player
Illasera_15.text: Do you feel the call as I do? The crawling in your blood?

Illasera_36.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_36.text: Unholy Assassin, your birth was a miracle. Bhaal conceived you from a place beyond mortality.

Illasera_37.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_37.text: Your birth, your creation... Father tended to you with love... He made you perfection...

Illasera_2.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_2.text: I am most interested to see what will become of you, Child of Murder.

Illasera_25.speaker: Player
Illasera_25.text: Can't be that quick if someone cut you down.

Illasera_21.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_21.text: You speak with arrogance - one that is familiar.

Illasera_33.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_33.text: The same arrogance has slain many of Bhaal's Chosen. Do not repeat our mistakes, Unholy Assassin.

Illasera_30.speaker: Player
Illasera_30.text: Is that why you're here? Punishment for killing Bhaal's offspring?

Illasera_1.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_1.text: No. For not killing enough of them. Father Bhaal cares not for a child that squanders his gifts.

Illasera_10.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_10.text: Anyone who squanders his gifts, in fact. Do not make that mistake, Unholy Assassin. He will be watching.

Illasera_34.speaker: Player
Illasera_34.text: Speaking of time - I've better things to do with mine. Goodbye.

Illasera_14.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_14.text: Leave a most grotesque path in your wake, Unholy Assassin. Lord Bhaal will be watching.

Illasera_12.speaker: Player
Illasera_12.text: How do you know all this?

Illasera_39.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_39.text: We are his Justices. We preside over his most profane tribunal - forevermore.

Illasera_18.speaker: Player
Illasera_18.text: No. My will is my own.

Illasera_26.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_26.text: In life - everyone thinks so. In death... You learn the folly of 'will'. I would know.

Illasera_7.speaker: Player
Illasera_7.text: I will do Bhaal's most unholy duty.

Illasera_38.speaker: Player
Illasera_38.text: It's perfect. Finally I feel free.

Illasera_6.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_6.text: Yes... In Murder's embrace you shall want for naught.

Illasera_16.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_16.text: Most wander this world like witless cattle - and you could become their butcher. Finish the ritual, Aspirant.

Illasera_28.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_28.text: Walk in the footsteps of murder, Child of Bhaal. Our Father is impatient for the blood-gifts of your slaughter.

Illasera_32.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_32.text: Walk in blood, Unholy Assassin. Stalk your prey swift, but savour their kill.

Illasera_35.speaker: Echo of Illasera
Illasera_35.text: Most wander this world like witless cattle - but you are the butcher. Finish the ritual, Bhaalspawn.

Amelyssan_7.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_7.text: Welcome, Unholy Assassin. You stand among common killers, children of Murder, and would-be gods. Auspicious company indeed.

Amelyssan_47.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_47.text: So which are you? Common killer, child of Murder, or would-be god?

Amelyssan_22.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_22.text: I tricked the first, devoured the second - all in pursuit of the third. Godhood.

Amelyssan_70.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_70.text: Does that make you a victim of such slaughter?

Amelyssan_43.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_43.text: I know my place. I have spent much time pondering it.

Amelyssan_2.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_2.text: Common killers? Bhaal ought not consort with anyone but his own elect Spawn.

Amelyssan_52.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_52.text: You are all blood-blind butchers, and have forgotten how to meditate on your murders.

Amelyssan_11.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_11.text: Bhaal should not consort with common murderers. They're beneath him.

Amelyssan_1.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_1.text: What makes you any better? The vast swathes butchered in your wake?

Amelyssan_41.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_41.text: Tell me - do any of them feel as good as your first kill?

Amelyssan_6.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_6.text: But it wanes compared to the first. I have spent much time contemplating this.

Amelyssan_27.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_27.text: I am Amelyssan the Blackhearted. I stood as Bhaal's high priestess - his eternal succour. Until I sought to usurp him.

Amelyssan_10.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_10.text: The Bhaalists made a memorial of your death.

Amelyssan_34.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_34.text: To die among the stars, in the Astral Plane. It was a fine death. Perhaps the best.

Amelyssan_24.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_24.text: Tell me, Bhaalspawn. How do you wish to die?

Amelyssan_18.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_18.text: When I am the last creature alive in a dead world, then I will slit my own throat.

Amelyssan_71.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_71.text: You really are the most perfect of his children yet born.

Amelyssan_57.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_57.text: You know there is no being alive Bhaal will not claim. The ultimate victory in his war is to strike the last killing blow ever to be struck.

Amelyssan_49.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_49.text: A sorry thing, there will be no audience left for your finale.

Amelyssan_32.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_32.text: It will be in Father's Temple, with him watching.

Amelyssan_3.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_3.text: Perhaps you shall soon receive what you most desire.

Amelyssan_25.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_25.text: Of old age, with my loved ones all around me, in bed.

Amelyssan_38.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_38.text: You mock death? Know that somewhere in the filthy air you breathe, Lord Bhaal is always laughing. And he laughs at you.

Amelyssan_61.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_61.text: I need not. My beloved has the key to immortality.

Amelyssan_9.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_9.text: One night, in thousands of years, you shall watch the stars collapse in the heavens in each other's arms, and be broiled to the bone.

Amelyssan_40.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_40.text: Then Lord Bhaal shall claim what was long overdue.

Amelyssan_29.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_29.text: It's not something I think about.

Amelyssan_26.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_26.text: I spent my life preparing for myself a death that none could look away from. The very Gods, ALL OF THEM, were forced to watch my fall at the Mana Forge.

Amelyssan_63.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_63.text: Every time you kill, every time a life gives up in disgrace afore your eyes, you must imagine how you will die better.

Amelyssan_44.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_44.text: You should hope for a fraction of the honour.

Amelyssan_51.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_51.text: 'His eternal succour'? Did you graft Spawn with him?

Amelyssan_56.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_56.text: Such a question Sarevok must ask me thrice a year. He deludes himself with suspicions of living Spawn from my womb. There are none.

Amelyssan_13.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_13.text: For devotees of death, you of his line are so basely fascinated with propagating new life. It ever seemed to me an impurity in the doctrine.

Amelyssan_74.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_74.text: It was my triumph to die among the stars, in the Astral Plane. It was a fine death. Perhaps the best.

Amelyssan_8.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_8.text: Why would Bhaal keep around one of his foes?

Amelyssan_72.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_72.text: Sarevok and the tainted faithful see it as an honour to serve Bhaal even in death. He knows to me, it is a slave-sentence.

Amelyssan_37.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_37.text: The Lord of Murder did not take kindly to betrayal.

Amelyssan_20.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_20.text: Bhaal seems to attract a lot of usurpers as followers.

Amelyssan_68.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_68.text: Ambition is our curse. We have no choice - murder begets it. Always.

Amelyssan_21.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_21.text: Go, Unholy Assassin. Walk in blood, enjoy Bhaal's favour. But never lose sight of that first, perfect murder.

Amelyssan_62.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_62.text: And now you're a ghost who lives under a tombstone shop.

Amelyssan_69.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_69.text: I'm guessing the challenge met with failure.

Amelyssan_60.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_60.text: My favourite kill was that of mine own dearest.

Amelyssan_42.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_42.text: A mere crime of passion. You must kill without prejudice, without distinction, without reason. Death without motive is truth.

Amelyssan_66.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_66.text: I take no pleasure in killing. It is merely a tool.

Amelyssan_53.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_53.text: Ah - but a tool to what end?

Amelyssan_17.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_17.text: To kill once is to taste godhood. Every kill thereafter is an attempt to sup that ecstasy again.

Amelyssan_45.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_45.text: Learn this, and you may yet strive for such heightened deaths as mine.
Amelyssan_45.context: NodeContext: smug - her death was incredibly flashy

Amelyssan_73.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_73.text: Exactly. That is why our ambition kills us all, in the end.

Amelyssan_58.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_58.text: I don't care for your questions.

Amelyssan_75.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_75.text: Arrogant indeed. Very well - walk in blood, Unholy Assassin. But tread lightly.

Amelyssan_14.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_14.text: You have found your way to the Murder Tribunal - Bhaal's favour is yours to grasp.

Amelyssan_31.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_31.text: You reek of his blood. You snivel here looking for scab-scrapings of his favour. Snivel well, murder-whelp.

Amelyssan_46.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_46.text: I consumed many Bhaalspawn in my life, their essence my spellfodder. If I lived yet, you would be eaten.

Amelyssan_55.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_55.text: I wish you good slaughter, Unholy Assassin. Delight in it - while you still can.

Amelyssan_15.speaker: Player
Amelyssan_15.text: You are mistaken. I would be the one to eat you.

Amelyssan_19.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_19.text: Leave me, little Bhaal-stain. Cast your perversions elsewhere, while I meditate on pure, perfect, death.

Amelyssan_64.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_64.text: Hail, Unholy Assassin. You have fulfilled a fraction of your blood's dark promise.

Amelyssan_50.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_50.text: You are learning it takes more than birth-blood alone to become a consecrated killer. It takes belief.

Amelyssan_12.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
Amelyssan_12.text: It was known to those who walked this path before you - common killers, children of Murder, and would-be gods. And now it is known to you.

AD_DeathKnights_Weak_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_DeathKnights_Weak_0.text: *In its silence, you feel your own thoughts falter. Its presence alone seems to draw the warmth from your bones. *

AD_DeathKnights_Weak_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_DeathKnights_Weak_1.text: *Its breath is dank and coarse, but it has no words. This creature is mute.*

Merchant_0.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_0.text: Dragon-spawn, you are truly worthy of containing the Lord of Murder's immortal essence.

Merchant_23.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_23.text: The perfect child, from the strongest stock. He made you well.

Merchant_2.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_2.text: Spawn, you speak to another of your fallen family. It is heartening to see a child once again brimming with promise.

Merchant_13.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_13.text: All us wretched spectres, Bhaal's failures, are watching your rise with great anticipation.

Merchant_14.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_14.text: Honoured Spawn, have you come to peruse the instruments once more?

Merchant_19.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_19.text: You have killed well, Unholy Assassin. I am here to further your slaughter.

Merchant_28.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_28.text: In life, I was Abazigal, kin-killer of the Five. In death, I serve our Father still - until the world grows silent.

Merchant_16.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_16.text: I offer you instruments which will aid in enacting your foul whims.

Merchant_6.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_6.text: Bring deaths for Bhaal, hallowed child, or die in his name.

Merchant_26.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_26.text: Go forth, Unholy Assassin, desecrate in your stride.

Merchant_24.speaker: Player
Merchant_24.text: I found an effigy of your death.

Merchant_25.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_25.text: The weakness was my disgrace, but it was an honour to give myself to Bhaal's embrace.

Merchant_1.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_1.text: There is no shame greater than failing in his service. But even so, each death is a gift.

Merchant_21.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_21.text: The Five, my order of Father's spawn, were among the first to carve the philosophy that Sarevok's death began.

Merchant_27.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_27.text: We led our worship by killing the weakest of our own line, writing kin-slaying into the canon.

Merchant_4.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_4.text: We hunted down his insipid fledglings in droves, until we were all that was left. All but Sarevok's own murderer, who murdered me in turn.

Merchant_5.speaker: Player
Merchant_5.text: I thought I was the only dragonborn Bhaalspawn...

Merchant_7.speaker: Player
Merchant_7.text: I've never heard of a dragonborn Bhaalspawn.

Merchant_3.speaker: Player
Merchant_3.text: You are an inspiration to our kind.

Merchant_17.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_17.text: I am no half-blooded drake. Alive, I was a dragon of pure cerulean chrome. But oft the need arose to disguise myself thus.

Merchant_11.speaker: Echo of Abazigal
Merchant_11.text: Yes. Father Bhaal mated with a true dragon. Pray one day you have the honour of doing the same.

AD_Dolor_Betrayal_0.speaker: Meztli
AD_Dolor_Betrayal_0.text: You were ever so helpful - as thanks, I'll gut you quickly.

AD_Sarevok_Combat004_0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_Combat004_0.text: In death, you will please Bhaal.

AD_Sarevok_SmiteDolor_0.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
AD_Sarevok_SmiteDolor_0.context: NodeContext: "perish" is the vocal component of the spell Power Word Kill, one of the most powerful spells in DnD, needs significant oomph to it
